loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is a married businessman living Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a used motorcycle for his transportation business and also owns a retail shop. Price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, and high taxes are the main challenges he is facing. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goal is to own at least five motorcycles since his business is very lucrative. Aziz needs the loan to buy a new motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, age 27, is a married woman, and she has two children. She lives in a village close to the Mombasa municipality in Kenya.

Five years ago she established her own store for selling both new and second-hand clothes, and that is where she got her experience. She sells her clothes at the municipal market.

She is requesting a loan to buy more bundles of clothes to sell. This investment will help her keep her business stable, and it will help her get the income her family needs. Her goal is to always keep her business active. She wants to feel fulfilled as a person.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Mashrabkhon

texts.ru: Машрабхон женщина -предприниматель, которая имеет свой небольшой бизнес. Ей 54 года,  она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Она – бабушка и очень этим гордится. Занимается торговлей детской одежды и обуви. Опыт  в этой деятельности более 8 лет. Начала свой бизнес, чтобы помочь супругу вести их большое хозяйство и обустраивать детей. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 г. Этот кредит 8 по счету. Машрабхон ни разу не нарушала условия кредитования, а также доказала свою пунктуальность. Супруг Машрабхон очень ценит ее финансовую помощь и поддержку. На полученный кредит она хочет увеличить свой товарооборот, закупить школьную форму для детей так как скоро начинается учебный год. Машрабхон выражают свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mashrabkhon is a woman-entrepreneur who has her own small business. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children. She is a grandmother and is very proud of it. She sells children's clothing and shoes. She has more than eight years experience in this activity. She started her business to help her husband to support their large household and to equip the children. 

She has been cooperating with our organization since 2009 and this is her eighth loan. Mashrabkhon has never violated the terms of lending and has proven her punctuality. Mashrabkhon's husband very much appreciates the financial support and assistance. With the loan received, she wants to increase her inventory, to but school uniforms as soon as the school year begins. 

Mashrabkhon expresses her gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase children's school uniforms

loans.name: Assé's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de trois femmes qui habitent la même ville, elles sont solidaires, dynamiques et ont pour activité principale le commerce.

Madame Thiané la responsable est âgée de 35 ans; elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants. Elle mène une activité de confection et vente de draps et a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en jaune avec un châle de la même couleur autour des épaules et a levé la main droite.


Elle achète ses tissus à Dakar chaque mois, coud et revend à Louga.

Avec son prêt elle envisage d'acheter des tissus à 40000 F le rouleau pour augmenter les draps à revendre afin de gagner beaucoup de revenus.

Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettent de payer le loyer et d'assurer les fournitures scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three women who live in the same city. They are together as one and energetic, and their main work involves commerce. 

Ms. Thiané is the group's official. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a business making and selling bedsheets and has good experience in it. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right and dressed in yellow with a shawl of the same color around her shoulders, and her right hand is raised. 

She makes her purchases in Dakar each month, does the sewing, and resells her products in Louga.  

With her loan, she envisions buying some fabrics at 40,000 francs a roll in order to increase her bedsheets for sale, so as to earn more income. 

The profits obtained will enable her to pay the rent and ensure her children have school supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making and selling bedsheets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in Olkalau Town where he plants cash crops such as potatoes, maize and beans.He is 60 years old and married to Jane.

This will be his fifth loan and he plans to buy farm supplies which include fertilizer and seeds. He also plans to buy dairy feed for his dairy cattle. With the anticipated profits he plans to buy another cow.

In the future, Joseph plans to grow his farming business, make more income and be able to educate his children as well as improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and dairy feeds.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sina, a young mother of one dependent daughter, is 24 years old and lives in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns a living through working as a construction worker together with her husband. She has been doing construction work for 6 years, and she can earn about 19,000 KHR per day. Sina's group consists of three female members. This is the second loan for Sina, while the other two members in her group are new clients with VisionFund. The past loan has made her living conditions better than before. Now, she and other two members are seeking a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy construction materials to support her business including sand, cement, brick, etc. She hopes to earn more income and maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to support her business

loans.name: Miguel Etasnislado

texts.es: El Señor Miguel Habitante de la Comunidad de San Ignacio, Agriculto, a demas labara como vigilate en una casa privada, toda su vida se ha dedicado al cultivo de Piña y a travez de esos cultivo a sacada adelante a su familia e hijos, a veces se le dificulta un poco por que no puede reunir de una sola vez el capital necesario para darle el debido mantenimiento a sus plantillo. con este nuevo credito podra darle el mantenimiento necesario a su cultivo y comprara  los siguientes insumos: Urea, Completo 15-15-15, Gesepex, Divion y Terreden, con esto sus piñas podran crecer y madurarse, asi al mom ento de venderlas se las pagan a buen precio y sus ingresos mejoraran. Gracias a Afodenic quien a travez de fondos Kivan ayudan a personas  necesitadas a mejorar de vida.
texts.en: Miguel lives in the community of San Ignacio.  He is a farmer who also works as a security guard in a private house.  All his life he has been growing pineapples, and through this work he has provided for his children and his family.  At times he has had difficulties in gathering together at one time the capital he needs to provide maintenance for his crops.  With this new loan he will be able to maintain his crops; he will buy the following supplies: urea, fertilizers, herbicides, and other agricultural supplies.  With these supplies, his pineapples will grow and mature, he'll get a good price for them when he sells them, and his income will increase.  He thanks Afodenic, which through the Kiva funds, gives the help that people need to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his pineapple crops

loans.name: Nelly Felicitas

texts.es: Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Atinchik II, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos (3 mujeres y 1 varón). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Ella es dueña de un hospedaje y también de una tienda de venta de regalos. Ella dice que FINCA Perú le ayuda mucho, le gustan las facilidades de préstamos y capacitaciones que otras entidades no le ofrecen. Su sueño para el futuro es educar a todos sus hijos para que sean profesionales. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda como regalos.
texts.en:
Nelly belongs to the communal bank "Atinchik II." She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of four children (three daughters and one son). She has been a member of FINCA Perú for five years, and she is the owner of an inn and also a gift shop. 

Nelly says that FINCA Perú has helped her a lot; she likes the simplicity of the loans and the training that other entities don't offer her. Her dream for the future is to educate all her children so that they can be professionals. She will invest the loan she is requesting in merchandise for her shop, like gifts.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop, like gifts.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
You have never seen such wonderful Tajik women’s dresses as those sewn by Izzat. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all the details of her business. Izzat tries to help provide them all with a better quality of life.

The rapid development of the modern world means her children must keep up as well. That’s why eleven years ago Izzat began her business sewing traditional Tajik women’s dresses. She has her own workshop in the center of town. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to accrue many customers. Her family’s quality of life has been improving as well.

Izzat wants to develop her business further, but she needs to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric. She is applying for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy them. She promises to make her payments on time. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.name: Arabbibi

texts.ru: Араббиби женщина в возрасте 54 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Занимается торговлей готовой женской национальной одежды. Имеет опыт в этой сфере деятельности более 5 лет. Она имеет своих поставщиков – портних, которые постоянно поставляют ей товар, и своих покупателей. Араббиби добросовестная, пунктуальная, порядочная клиентка, сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. Она бабушка, и гордится тем, что имея свой бизнес может финансово помогать и поддерживать мужа,детей и даже внуков. На полученный кредит хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара. Она благодарна нашей организации за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Arabbibi is a 54-year-old woman who is married with five children. 

She sells ready-made women's traditional clothing. She has over five years experience in this field. She has suppliers--dressmakers--who constantly supply the goods to her and her customers. Arabbibi is a conscientious, punctual, and honest client, who has been working with our organization since 2009. 

She is a grandmother, and is proud of the fact that having her own business can financially help and support her husband, her children and even her grandchildren. 

With the loan received, she wants to increase her product range. She is grateful to our organization for the financial assistance and support.

loans.use: purchase of women's traditional clothing

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Rolando Habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa quien labora para el Hospital del Municipio han sacado adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios y el mayor sueño para don Rolando es mejorar de vida y terminar de construir su casa con este nuevo Credito el podra comprar los siguientes Materiales: Cemento, Arena, Plycem. la mayor dificultad para el señor Rolando es poder completar el dinero de una sola vez por los distintos gastos que se le presenta pero gracias al apoyo de su esposa pueden areglarselas con los gastos del hogar.
muy agradecido don Rolando con Afodenic quien a travez de Fondo Kiva lo han apoya a terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Rolando lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife, who works for the municipal hospital.  They have provided for the education of their children, and Rolando's main dream is to improve their life by finishing construction on his house.  With this new loan, he will be able to buy the following materials: cement, sand, and cement fiberboard.  Rolando's main difficulty has been to gather together all of the money he needs at one time to cover the various expenses that he faces.  But thanks to the support of his wife, they can cope with the expenses of the household.

Rolando is very grateful to Afodenic and Kiva, who are supporting his efforts to finish construction on his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials including cement, sand and cement fiberboard

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora, es socia del banco comunal “Amigas Por Siempre” del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos mayores.
Diez años que viene trabajan do con Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de comida china, tiene dos señoras que se encargan de cocinar y de atender a los clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 2 botellas de aderezo chino, 1 botella salsa de ostión, 1 botella de tamarindo, ½ caja de duraznos, ½ caja de pina en conserva, 10 paquetes de wantan.
Ya tiene sus clientes fijosal cilindro que es uno de los platos más solicitados, gracias a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos que tanto lo necesitan para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the communal bank "Amigas por Siempre," in the Yarinacocha district of the department of Ucayali.  She is 47 years old, married, and has 3 adult children.

Aurora has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for 10 years.  She has a business selling Chinese food.  She has 2 female assistants who are in charge of cooking and tending to the customers.

With her new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 2 bottles of Chinese dressing, 1 bottle of oyster sauce, 1 bottle of tamarind, 1/2 case of peaches, 1/2 case of pineapple preserves, and 10 packages of wontons.

She already has regular customers.  "Cilindro," or roasted meat, is one of the most requested dishes.  She thanks the Manuela Ramos organization for the loans that she needs so much in order to continue to be able to work.

loans.use: to buy rice, preserved foods and supplies

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has three children who range in age from three to 14. Two of his children go to school. He has earned a living as a rice farmer for 20 years and is requesting a loan to buy seeds and hire workers to help him on his farm.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire workers to help on a farm.

loans.name: Milca Aurora

texts.es:
La señorita Milca, es socia del banco comunal “Amigas Por Siempre”. Distrito Yarinacocha, departamento De Ucayali, tiene 27 años y es soltera
Hace poco tiempo que está en Manuela Ramos y tiene su propio negocio que es la venta de mercadería, la foto  fue tomada en el restaurant  de su mama es ahí donde vive.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: polos para hombres, 6 pantalones, 10 conjuntos para niños, 6 blusas, 3 vestidos.
Estos días le llegara toda la mercadería que mando a comprar a la ciudad de lima, le hace más fácil enviar el dinero para que lo compre otra persona así podrá ahorrar más dinero, gracias a Manuela Ramos por haberle dado el préstamo para que pueda invertir.
texts.en:
Milca is a member of the “Amigas Por Siempre” [Friends Forever] communal bank in the Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She is 27 years old and single.

She has been with Manuela Ramos for a short time, and she has her own business selling merchandise.  The photo was taken at her mother’s restaurant, which is where she lives.

She will use her new loan for 1,000 soles to buy polo shirts for men, six pants, ten children’s outfits, six blouses, and three dresses.

These days all of her merchandise, which she orders, arrives from the city of Lima.  It is easier for her to send the money in order for another person to purchase the merchandise.  This way she is able to save more money.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos for having given her the loan so that she is able to invest.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, pants, children's outfits, blouses, and dresses.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 30 years old, single and the mother of three children who are 12, eight and two years old. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling green tea leaves and earns a monthly income of Ksh. 5,000 from her work. She is requesting her first loan from Kiva, for KES. 20,000, to buy green tea leaves and milk to sell to her customers. She will use the profits she expects to earn from this loan to pay her children's school fees and support her family. Her hope for the future is to live a happy healthy life.

loans.use: to buy green tea leaves and milk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 46-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. For 10 years he has been farming, and with his profits, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and build a semi-permanent house. Price fluctuations, inflation, and unpredictable weather changes hinder his activities. His dream is to educate his children and diversify his business. Johnson wants a loan to buy land for growing more crops.

loans.use: To buy land for growing more crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is single and has earned a living as a rice farmer for the last four years. He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy seeds and hire workers to help him on his farm. He plans to use the profits he earns to set aside some savings and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire workers to help him on his farm.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem is 51 years old and has four sons who are dependents. She and some of her sons help with the family business of rice farming in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For the last 30 years, she has farmed 2.5 hectares of land and earned additional income by planting pineapples. Tem earns about $7 a day and is requesting a loan, her fourth, from Kiva and VisionQuest, for $500 to buy the spare parts she needs to repair her mini-tractor. She hopes this loan will allow her to fix her tractor in time for the next harvest so that she can earn enough money to support her family. She has repaid her previous loans fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair a tractor.

loans.name: Nely Magna

texts.es: Nely pertenece al Banco Comunal Atinchik II, tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos (5 mujeres y un varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años. Ella es profesora y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.  En este tiempo que viene trabajando con FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido la puntualidad, el compañerismo y la familiaridad, pero más que nada, ella ha aprendido a ahorrar. Su sueño para el futuro es que tanto sus hijos como sus nietos sean profesionales. El préstamo que necesita lo invertirá en su negocio, para la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, harina, fideos, bebidas, etc.
texts.en:
Nely belongs to the communal bank "Atinchik II." She is 60 years old, married, and the mother of six children (five daughters and one son). She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 15 years. She is a teacher and she has a grocery store in her house. 

In the time that she has been working with FINCA Perú, she has learned punctuality, teamwork, and interpersonal skills, but most of all, she has learned how to save money. Her dream for the future is that her children and her grandchildren become professionals. She needs this loan so she can invest it in her business, purchasing merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, oil, flour, pasta, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, flour, pasta, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Doris, es socia del banco comunal “Amigas Por Siempre”. Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 52 años de edad, casada, tres hijos.
Son diez años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y cuenta con una bodega, acondiciono un lugar de su casa para poner su negocio, tiene la ayuda de uno de sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 1 caja de mayonesa, 1 caja de kétchup, 1 caja de mermelada, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de aceite, 1 paquete de haría de 100 gramos, 4 paquetes de papel higiénicos.
Su esposo trabaja como vendedor y Doris lo ayuda con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de su bodega, agradece a Manuela Ramos por toda la ayuda brindada y desea seguir trabajando por muchos años más.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the “Amigas Por Siempre” [Friends Forever] communal bank in the Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for ten years.  She set up a place to put her business, a grocery store, which is in her house.  One of her children helps her.

She will use her new loan for 1,000 soles to buy one case of mayonnaise, one case of ketchup, one case of marmalade, one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, one case of cooking oil, one 100 gram package of flour, and four packets of toilet paper.

Her husband works as a salesman, and Doris helps him with the income she gets from her sales at the grocery store.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for all of the help they have given her.  She wants to continue working for many more years.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, marmalade, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Florecitas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Rosa quien tiene un taller de elaboración de cepillos, Maricela quien vende ropa y María comerciante de cepillos.
Rosa de 42 años de edad desde hace 15 años empezó a elaborar cepillos de lavar, cepillos de lustrar y cepillos para lavar pachas. Esta actividad la aprendió de su hermano el cual trabajaba en un taller y le enseño a su familia hacerlo. 
El crédito lo invertirá en materiales nailon, madera, pelo, grapas, alambre…etc.
texts.en:
El Florecitas group is composed of three hardworking people. They are Rosa, who has a workshop making brushes, Maricela, who sells clothes and María, who is a merchant selling brushes.

Rosa, 42, began making brushes for scrubbing, polishing and washing baby’s bottles 15 years ago. She learned the business from her brother, who worked in a factory and then taught his family how to make them.

She will invest the loan in materials such as nylon, wood, hairs, staples, wire, etc.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, wood, staples, wire, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more green bananas to resell.

loans.name: Maria Idalia

texts.es:
La señora idalia esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito con nosotros para surtir su pequeña venta ya que como se acerca la entrada a las escuelas ella desea poder adquirí nueva ropa para poder vendar antes que la gente esta muy apretada por los gastos escolares y como es esta temporada hay un mayor flujo de personas desea vender al menos el doble de lo que regularmente vende.
Ya tiene mas de 6 años dedicándose al comercio anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cobertores y cobijas pero como el negocio ya no daba lo suficiente opto por la venta de ropa de segundo uso, mientras que su esposo trabaja en Laredo Texas como transfer toda la semana y solo viene una vez a la semana a la ciudad así ambos con dos ingresos solventan los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Idalia is requesting a loan from us again to stock her small sales venue since the school year is beginning and she wants to be able to acquire new clothes so she can sell them before people are pressed by school expenses. As this is the season, there is a larger influx of people wanting to sell, at least double the number who usually sell in the area.

She has spent more than 6 years engaged in this trade. Formerly she sold blankets and bedclothes, however that business did not earn enough, so she chose to sell second hand clothing, while her husband works in Laredo, Texas as a transfer driver all week and only comes to the city once a week. Together, with their two salaries, they are able to pay for family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Catherine from Torkpoi town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 20 and 32 years old. One of her children is in university. In 1985, Catherine established her pharmacy business. She began her business because there was no medical centre within her neighborhood. She works at the business 15 hours a day, every day. .She describes her major problem as insufficient capital to operate her business. 

Catherine requires a loan in order to buy more medicine like (ORS) oral rehydration salt, blood syrup and malarial drugs. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a clinic. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicine like (ORS) oral rehydration salt, blood syrup and malarial drugs

loans.name: Komila

texts.en: Komila is not married and has no children. She lives with parents. She always wanted to provide them with good living conditions. Since her parent’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Komila decided to start a new business in animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.  If you will help her with money, she will buy sheep. She studied a course ‘To get a success’ from a women's organization and learned skills about business.  Her parents will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy cattle for her new business. She will get through using the loan and her business will be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory and maintain her Xerox machine. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of school supplies and maintain her Xerox machine. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more school supplies and maintain her Xerox machine.

loans.name: Margaritas De Tilata Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITA DE TILATA II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de abarrotes, atención de internet, venta de comida, tejido en macramé, venta de ropa, venta de jugos, tejido de mantas, confección de corbatas y mandiles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chicharrones; da a conocer que  este emprendimiento fue de iniciativa propia, pues ella requería de ingresos con urgencia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación del negocio (alquiler de espacio de venta) mismo que estará ubicado en la Ciudad de El Alto, donde venderá todos los días la comida preparada. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Elena porque tuvo que marcharse de inmediato a su fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Margarita de Tilata II” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has seven members led by a governing board presided over by Basilia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of commercial activities among which we have grocery store, Internet access services, food sales, macramé weaving, clothes sales, games sales, blanket weaving, necktie and apron making.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit microbusinesses one of which is Basilia’s.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited to do so by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home to invite her.  She currently has a business selling fried pork.  She relates that this enterprise arose from her own initiative because she urgently required income.

The loan she’ll take out now is to expand the business (to rent a space for her sales).  It will be located in the city of El Alto and she’ll sell prepared food every day there.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her family in the best way possible since she has a spouse and two children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.  

Elena does not appear in the photo because she had to leave immediately to go to work.

loans.use: to rent a space.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is married and has six children aged 16 and 26 years old. She has a pair of twins as her last borns. She has been a rice farmer for 11 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to use her in seedling beds and too pay labor costs. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children and to pay for medical insurance. She is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs for her rice production.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Charito is making and selling homemade peanut butter. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to make peanut butter.

Charito is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Charito hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make peanut butter

loans.name: Eben-Ezer Paxot Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana es viuda, tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica, específicamente guipiles y cortes, inicio este negocio con su señora  madre y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente colores y telas típicas para la elaboración y reparación de guipiles, para luego venderlos, en el futuro espera contar con un trabajador que le ayude a a entregar su producto terminado y otra persona para la fabricación de guipiles y cortes. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía, específicamente  al tejido.
texts.en:
Sra. Sebastiana is a widow, 54 years old, who never had the opportunity to attend school. She has 6 children, two of whom are in school. She makes and sells traditional clothing, specifically “guipiles y cortes” (blouses and skirts). She started this business with her mother and has had 25 years of experience, so far.

She is organizing a group to apply for a loan that can be used to purchase different colored thread and traditional fabrics for the production and repair of traditional blouses and then sell them. In the future, she hopes to have a worker to help her deliver her finished products and another person to help make the blouses and skirts. The rest of the members of the group are also engaged in handicrafts, specifically weaving.

loans.use: to purchase thread and traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Octavio Alberto

texts.es: El Sr Octavio casado y con dos hijos adolecentes, tiene mas de 30 años dedicándose a la venta de tacos, su esposa es maestra de apoyo en una escuela de la localidad, necesita invertir en el negocio para tener más variedad en la venta de comida y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La venta de tacos es muy productiva y se ha hecho de clientes distinguidos que a diario lo visitan por pedidos de tacos para toda la familia ya que dice el ingrediente secreto para hacerlos es la dedicación y la motivación de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Octavio’s married and has two adolescent children.  He’s been selling tacos for more than 30 years.  His wife’s a teaching assistant at a local school.  He needs to invest in his business in order to have more variety of food to sell and to improve his family’s quality of life.  

Taco sales are quite profitable and he’s attained a distinguished clientele who visit him daily to order tacos for their entire families; he says that his secret ingredient is dedication and motivation to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 4 years and 11 years. She runs a general merchandise business in Torkpoi town, Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells milk, palm oil, soap, batteries, and cigarettes at her house. Her business is her only source of income. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy general stock items like milk, palm oil, soap, batteries, and cigarettes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy general stock items like milk, palm oil, soap, batteries, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is 47 years old and lives with his two children and wife in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His two children are secondary school students.

Altangerel started to sell wood and coal at the local market in 2000 with his wife. Their children help with the business on the weekends. With the profits he earned over the years, he started a recycling materials trade business in 2008.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to buy more recycling materials and mini tractor for the business to deliver his recycling materials. He is a kind man who says "We planing to build a house with the profits we earn. And we are trusted clients of Хасbank."

loans.use: To buy more recycling materials and mini tractor for the business to deliver his recycling materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add newspapers for sale.

loans.name: 10 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “10 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fermina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chicharrones, tejido de mantas de alpaca y vicuña, costura de polleras, venta de papas fritas, venta y entrega de joyas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fermina es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de manta de vicuña y alpaca; da a conocer que  este negocio lo aprendió de su madre desde hace tiempo atrás, ya que ella ayudaba a realizar los tejidos; con el tiempo ella decidió emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de insumos (compra de lanas por mayor) mismo que comprará de las fabricas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido por mayor. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud y el ahorro.

En la foto no esta presente la señora Alejandra, ya que fue a consultamédica.
texts.en: The communal association "10 de Julio" will begin the first cycle of Pro Mujer, as a part of the Focal Center of Santiago II. It has 6 members and it is directed by a board presided by Fermina. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied: sale of pork rinds, knitting alpaca and vicuna wool blankets, sewing skirts, sale of fried potato chips, sale and delivery of jewels. The loan they will get will help small micro-entrepreneurs, including Fermina. Fermina tells that this is the first time she is a member of Pro Mujer, and she entered thanks to the invitation from a promoter of the institution that went over to her house to invite her. Currently she knits alpaca and vicuna wool blankets. She learned about this business from her mother a long time ago, since she helped her with the knitting. With time, she decided to start her own business. The loan she will take now is to buy supplies (buy wool at wholesale) from factories and will later on produce it and sell it at wholesale. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has 3 children. When she is asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area and the savings. In the picture Alejandra is not present because she had a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the floors and build a sidewalk.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús trabaja en un maquiladora, esta separado de su esposa con la cual procreo a dos hijos maravillosos pero no los quiso dejar sin nada así que les dejo la casa y aparte les da apoyo económico y el ahora vive con su mamá pero un poco apretado y quiere hacer un cuarto de madera para él y con ello no molestar a su mamá quitándole espacio dentro de su casa así brindando privacidad mutua.
texts.en: Jesús works in an assembly plant.  He’s separated from his wife but has two wonderful children he didn’t want to leave empty handed so he left them the house and also provides economic support.  He now lives with his mother but in pretty tight quarters.  He wants to build a wood room for himself in order not to burden his mother anymore taking up space inside her house and to also provide mutual privacy.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: El Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mar lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Dina de 39 años de edad quien tiene una pulpería la cual inicio hace 8 años con la venta de chiverías. Además ha invertido en otros rubros como es la venta de ropa y cosméticos negocio en el que invertirá el crédito.
Las otras integrantes son Anyuli quien elabora melcocha (dulce tradicional) desde hace 8 años y Martha quien vende Yoltamal y Elotes.
texts.en:
The group "El mar" is composed of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is 39-year-old Dina, who has a neighborhood market that she started eight years ago by selling snacks. In addition, she has invested in other areas, like the sale of clothing and cosmetics; it is in that business that she will invest this loan. 

The other members are Anyuli, who has been making "melcocha" (a traditional sweet) for eight years, and Martha, who sells "yoltamal y elotes" [sweet corn-and-cheese tamales and corn on the cob].

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pro Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRO FORTALEZA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yanina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de instrumentos, venta de cosméticos, útiles y juguetes, costura de estuches, vena de productos EVON, venta de guitarras y zampoñas, venta de artefactos, venta de comida, venta de salchipapa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yanina es una integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; cuenta que  le atrajo esta actividad porque es fácil y le da tiempo para atender a su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de mercadería (compra de cosméticos) mismo que adquirirá de la frontera de Bolivia y Perú y lo comercializará en las ferias semanales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The “Pro Fortaleza” (For Strength) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has ten members led by a governing board headed by Yanina.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have instrument sales, cosmetics sales, school supplies and toys, sewing kits, Avon products sales, guitar and zampoña [type of pan flute] sales, crafts sales and salchipapas [fried potatoes with fried sausages] sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesses among which is Yanina’s.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago having been invited by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling cosmetics.  She relates that she was attracted to this business because it’s easy and leaves her with time to tend to her family.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy merchandise.  She will buy cosmetics along the Bolivia-Perú border and will resell it in the weekly street markets.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family because she’s single and has three children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Yovany

texts.es: La Sra. Yovany  tiene 33 años tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 3 y 7 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de comidas, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Cabezas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Yovany va a usar este préstamo para implementar un negocio nuevo de ferretería su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo y para obtener recursos para subsistir, la Sra. es una persona muy trabajadora siempre quiere tener otros ingresos dedicándose a distintas actividades y esta es la oportunidad para abrir un negocio nuevo  la Sra. Yovany va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia, su deseo es crecer en sus actividades y mejorar sus ingresos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Yovany, 33, has two children whose ages are 3 and 7.  She prepares food to sell.   Her food stand is located in Cabezas.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Yovany will use the loan to start a new hardware business.  The reason for requesting the loan is the lack of cash and to obtain resources necessary to subsist.

She is a very hardworking person who always wants to earn additional income by working at a variety of activities and this is an opportunity to open a new business.  Yovany will use profits to improve her customers’ quality of life as well as her family’s.  her wish is to grow in her activities and to improve her income.  She feels grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: to start a new hardware business.

loans.name: Sonia Lorena

texts.es:
Sonia, vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella y de su esposo, se dedica a la venta de oro enchapado y plata, el negocio lo aprendió a través de su hermana y tiene seis años de estar atendiendo.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de prendas enchapadas en oro y plata como aretes, pulseras, collares, también mercería, que son necesarios para mantener un negocio surtido de productos novedosos, y que esto le permitirá lograr la fidelidad de sus clientes atrayendo también a nuevos, con la intención de elevar sus ganancias.

El objetivo de Sonia es poder generar una mejor estabilidad en el negocio, pensando conceguirla a través de la inversión de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in her own house with her two minor children who depend economically on her and her husband.  She sells gold- and silver-plated jewelry, a business she learned from her sister; she’s been in business six years.

She’s asking for a loan to buy gold- and silver-plated items like earrings, bracelets, necklaces and also to buy miscellany which is necessary to keep the business well-stocked with novel items so that she can make her customers happy and also attract new ones aiming at increasing her profits.

Sonia’s goal is to generate better stability in her business and she believes she will be able to do so by means of this loan.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, necesita invertir nuevamente en su granja para dinamizar el negocio, por esto se ha motivado a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de vacunas y pollos de engorde, también se comprara concentrado para alimentarlos, esta nueva inversión le permitirá darle fortaleza a su granja.

Con el crédito anterior aumento y fortaleció su negocio, ha logrado mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo una mejor ganancia económica para cubrir las necesidades en su familia, ella es una mujer trabajadora y saca el mayor provecho de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mercedes needs to invest once again in her farm to add a spark to her business.  In order to do so she’s motivated to request a new loan to buy vaccines and chicks to raise.  She will also buy concentrate to feed them.  This new investment will make it possible for her to strengthen her farm.

She used the previous loan to increase and strengthen her business.  She’s succeeded in increasing sales while at the same time earning higher profits to cover her family’s needs.  She’s a hardworking woman who gets the best use out of her work.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and chicks to raise.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es alguien joven ya comprometido con una familia que se comprende de su esposa y dos hijos pequeños. El y su esposa trabajan en una maquiladora y poco a poco han ido complementando su casa con le ingreso de los dos, quieren hacer un mejoramiento en el patio trasero de su vivienda con un barda como protección de la delincuencia y de sus hijos para que no se salgan o les pase un accidente.
texts.en: Eduardo is a young man already committed to a family composed of his wife and two small children.  He and his wife work in an assembly plant and gradually have been improving their house with both their incomes.  They want to improve the back yard building a rear wall to protect from crime and so that their children won’t be able to get out and perhaps suffer an accident.

loans.use: to build a rear wall.

loans.name: Ndéye's Group

texts.fr:
Ces deux membres bénéficiaires de crédit sont du Banc Villageois de Soukaly Gouyar Alte créé le 28 décembre 2010, elles habitent le même village et tissent de bonnes relations amicales.

L'emprunteur en vedette madame Ndéye a 28 ans c'est une femmes mariée sans enfant; elle est coiffeuse et a un salon de coiffure dans le village et son activité marche très bien. Elle est à droite sur la photo tenant un livret.


Elle va équiper son salon en achetant du matériel pour la coiffure ( mèches, greffage, pots de gel,....ciseaux) et des chaises.


Les bénéfices lui permettent d'épargner, de prendre en charge ses besoins et d'aider ses parents.
texts.en:
These two members who will benefit from this loan belong to the Soukaly Gouyar Alte banc villageois, which was created on 28 December 2010. They live in the same village, and are good friends.

The featured borrower is Ndéye. She is 28 years of age, married, and has no children. She works as a hair stylist, and has a hair salon in the village. Her business is doing really well. Ndéye is pictured on the right holding a book. She plans to equip her salon by buying hairdressing materials (hair extensions, weave, pots of gel, scissors, etc.) and chairs. Her profits will allow her to save, provide for herself and help her parents.

loans.use: to equip her hair salon

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: El sr. Mario solicita el préstamo para comprar la materia prima que es la barbacoa para preparar, menudo y desechables.  También para arreglar un poco el vehículo en el que se traslada, comenta que las ventas de unos meses a la fecha no has sido muy buenas por lo que solicita el préstamo para surtirse de mercancía necesaria y de ser posible incluir otro platillo para ofrecer a sus clientes además de la barbacoa y el menudo. Se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace mas de 6 años, además es pastor de una iglesia pentecostés del cual también obtiene un ingreso mensual y su esposa la sra. Norma trabaja desde hace varios años limpiando casas en Laredo Texas. Tienen un hijo en edad escolar y con sus ingresos solventan los gastos escolares y de manutención de su hijo así como los demás gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mario is requesting the loan to buy raw materials such as disposable items and barbecued meat to prepare menudo, as well as to fix up the vehicle in which he gets around.  He comments that the sales for the last few months haven't been very good, so he's requesting the loan to stock up on the necessary merchandise and to be able to include another dish to offer to his customers besides barbecued meat and menudo.

He has worked selling food for more than six years.  In addition, he's the pastor of a Pentecostal church, from which he also receives a monthly income.  His wife Norma has worked for several years cleaning houses in Laredo, Texas.  They have a school-aged son, and with Mario's income they pay for his school expenses and support as well as for the other family expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on ingredients for selling food

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah has a grocery store business in Naivasha town and has been in the business for three years. She is 50 years old and a single mother of two children.

This being her first loan, she plans to buy more stock of fruits and potatoes for sale in her business. Due to the high demand for potatoes in the area, she anticipates making profits with which she plans to improve the living standards of her family.

In the future, Jedidah hopes to grow her business by adding more grocery items for sale and thereby making more income.

loans.use: to add more stock of fruits and potatoes.

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is married and has six children aged between three and fifteen. Four of his children are enrolled in schools. He has been a rice grower for 32 years. 

He has requested a Kiva loan to use for a seedling bed and for support labor costs. He plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children, savings, and paying for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for a seedling bed and support labor costs.

loans.name: Karungule Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Eurelia is a 65-year-old widowed woman with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been trading in agricultural produce for ten years. 

She started with a family contribution and over time her business has picked up. She has a challenge of customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. She has a personal goal of educating her children and a business goal of expanding her business into new markets. 

Eurelia wants a loan to buy agricultural produce such as maize and beans for resale. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce such as maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 29 years old and married with a child who is six years old. For the past eight years, he has been a barber.

Antony is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD to buy a modern shaving machine to provide better service to his customers. He hopes to expand his business and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a modern shaving machine

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 35-year-old businessman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda, where he runs a second-hand clothing business. He has been able to provide for his family's basic need with his proceeds. Peter's main business hardships are theft, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and the seasonal nature of his business. 

Peter is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell. His personal goals are to educate his  children and buy a car and his business plan is to hire employees to help expand his business and to buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Ocomisto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OCOMISTO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de leche, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es una integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; cuenta que  hace veinte años que esta realizando esta actividad, desde que ella adquirió ganados.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su capital (compra de ganado vacuno) mismo que adquirirá de las comunidades de Bolivia y posteriormente lo elaborará yogurt para posteriormente comercializarlo a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y los ahorros.

En la fotografía no esta presenta la señora Graciala por temas culturales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “OCOMISTO” will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer ("pro Women") as part of the Andes Focus Centre. It is made up of eight members and run by a management board of which Nicolasa is the President. The  businesses which the members carry on are varied and amongst them are milk production, shoe sales, clothing sales, sweater knitting, local stores and jacket sales.

They will use the loan they are asking for in their small micro-businesses.

Nicolasa is one member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 5 years and joined on invitation from one of the institution's promotors who came to her house to invite her. At the moment she has a milk sales business. She has been carrying on this business for twenty years, since she acquired cows.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying cows which she will acquire from Bolivian communities and she will then make yogurt for commercialization according to demand. This work will allow her to generate income to support her family and improve it's opportunities since she is married with four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the loan and savings. 

Graciala does not appear in the photo for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old. She lives in a small village in Kwale District with her husband and son. Her small family lives in their own house with both electricity and running water. Agnes supports her family through the sale of food in a small cafe. Her demand has increased.

Agnes is requesting a loan to buy greater quantities of ingredients such as wheat flour, rice, meat, carry powder, and other items. Her loan will help her expand her business and improve her quality of life and offer her child a better social status. In the future, Agnes wants to open a hotel and she hopes to achieve this goal shortly.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, rice, meat, curry powder and other items

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old and married to Beatrice. They have two children, ages two and four years old. Joseph is from Nakuru and, for the past seven years, he has operated a pharmacy.

Joseph is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD to buy different medicines to stock in his pharmacy to sell. In the near future, he hopes to expand and venture into the transportation business.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene, 32 years old, lives with her husband and her daughter in a small house in Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband`s name is Gantur, age 32, and he works in the private sector. Her daughter`s name is Egshiglen, age two, and she stays at home. From 2000 to 2005, Bolor-Erdene worked in Mongolia's biggest cashmere factory as a knitter.

She has now decided to start up her own cashmere-producing business based on her working experience and skill, and so is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase new textile equipment. Because she knows many buyers, Bolor-Erdene does not need to worry about sales.

loans.use: to purchase new textile equipment.

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: La Señorita Carla tiene 21 años, es soltera se dedica a la  actividad de venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella visita distintas entidades públicas y privadas algunos domicilios,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carla va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de productos  por mayor que se encuentran en promoción en las revistas  y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Señorita Carla va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos, la Señorita Carla  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y continuar con sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Carla is 21 years old and single. She makes a living selling cosmetics by catalog. She visits different public and private places, including some homes. This loan is her first loan cycle with the institution. 

Carla is going to use this loan to buy wholesale products that are on sale in the magazines. In this way she will provide a variety of products to her customers and increase her earnings. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Carla is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of products. 

She is a very hard working person. She is happy for the opportunity provided because it is the only work that she is able to maintain while continuing with her higher education.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products that are on sale.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra maiz y papa y luego lo vende en los diferentes mercados y tambien la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de elaboracion y venta de quesos,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus negocios de agricultura y ganaderia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to make a living in livestock and agriculture.  This member has land where she plants corn and potatoes and then sells them in different markets.  She also makes a living making and selling cheese.  Through this business she is able to improve her agriculture and livestock business.  Her dream is to grow and strengthen her agriculture business.  She is seeking a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her crops.  

She is very happy for this loan and promises to repay according to the loan agreements.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labour

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 26-year-old business man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop which he started with only 50,000 Ugandan shillings after selling sugarcane.

The main hardships he is facing are inadequate capital to purchase stock, customers not paying on time and high taxes. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home while his business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding his business into new markets and owning a wholesale shop.

Charles wants a loan to buy sugar, rice and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and soap to sell

loans.name: Manasseh

texts.en:
Manasseh is single. He has been a rice grower for 2 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to use for bed seedlings and support labor costs. He plans to use the profits for savings and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to use for bed seedlings and support labor costs

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar is married and has two children who are 9 and 12 years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education as she is divorced and her husband doesn’t help her. She decided to start a new business making different kinds of salads in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. If you will help her with money, she would buy products for preparing salads. 

She studied a course of "To Get Success" from a women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 500 Tajikistan somoni (TJS) for organizing the new business. She will get through, using a loan, and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy products for making salad.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old. She is married to Peter, and together they have two children. She operates a beauty salon and has been in the business for the past five years with good income.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase relaxers, hair weaves and hair conditioners and shampoos.

She hopes to own the biggest salon in her area.

loans.use: to purchase relaxers, hair weaves and hair conditioners and shampoos.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph still operates a spare parts shop. He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use the loan to add more stock of spare parts so that he can offer the best service to his customers.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will boost his business by buying old metals and oil. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase mechanic working tools like spanners, bolts etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John needs a loan to buy maize to sell. He is a 41-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been buying and selling maize for sixteen years and the business is profitable as he has been able to build a house. John’s major challenge is the high cost of rent and electricity for his business. He still has his big dream of owning a store and becoming a major supplier.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: A citizen from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Sorn is a 33-year-old married father of one daughter and one son, both of whom are still dependent on him and still in school. He and his wife are farmers, growing rice on one hectare of farmland. In their spare time, they also have earned extra income by producing palm juice and raising pigs. He has been in these businesses for twelve years and they earn him about KHR 50,000 per day. Sorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back the past loan. It relieved his family’s burden and improved its livelihood. Now he is requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy fertilizer for his farmland and to use a portion of it to purchase pig feed. He hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to set aside some money to buy extra plots of land for expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Martias

texts.en:
Martias is still single and supports his parents and his business is doing well.  He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Martias will use the loan to buy more stock of spare parts for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he hopes to boost his business.  His hopes and dreams are to educate his siblings and support his parents.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for his business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Juana, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Hijos de Qolquewasi” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia con 3 hijos en edad escolar que dependen de ella, la socia que se sigue dedicando a la venta de fruta en un pequeño puesto de venta, y es con esta actividad que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, uno de ellos  actualmente está preparándose para ingresar a la universidad, Juana en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería como duraznos, mandarinas, plátanos, naranjas y ciruelos. Juana quiere ver a su hijo estudiando en la universidad y por él esta haciendo todo este sacrificio ya que la preparación en una academia pre universitaria representa una inversión económica considerable.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, una mejor educación a sus hijos y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Our member is Juana.  She belongs to the communal bank "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi" (The Children of Qolquewasi) in Cusco, Peru.  She is a young mother of three school-aged children who depend on her.  She makes a living selling fruit from a small stand and it is with this business that she has been able to support her three children.  One of her children is actually preparing to register for university.

Juana, with this opportunity, will invest the loan to purchase supplies like peaches, tangerines, bananas, oranges and plums.  Juana is making this sacrifice for her son as she wants to see him study at a university now that his preparation in high school represents a considerable financial investment. 

She is very grateful that KIVA allows her to give her family a better quality of life, a better education for her children, and for helping her grow and strengthen her activities.

loans.use: to purchase peaches, tangerines, plantains, oranges and plums.

loans.name: 01.07.14 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Thủy is applying for a loan to purchase household commodities in general to resell. She has a retail business selling stationary items.

Thủy is 42 years old, and she is married with two children. Thủy lives in Đông Sơn ward, Thanh Hoa city with two dependents. Thủy is the group leader of the 14 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2009, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities in general to resell.

loans.name: Ruzimo

texts.en: Ruzimo has been a widow since 1986. She has 2 children who are 25 and 30 years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good quality of living. This year she decided to start a new business sewing national dresses in order to generate income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. If you will help her with money, she would buy cloth and thread. She studied at the course, "To Get a Success", a women's organization, where she got  skills for business. She will be a very successful businesswoman, as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Tjs to buy fabrics for the new business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her business

loans.name: Amosi

texts.en: Amosi is a 38 year-old businessman living in Bundibgyo, Uganda.  For eleven years, he has been running a stationery shop. He offers a number of services, such as photocopying and binding, and also sells books. The main hardships the client faces is customers not paying on time and the high cost of rent.  His personal goal is to upgrade his studies, while his business dream is to own a modern stationery shop.  Amosi intends to use the loan to buy text books to sell.

loans.use: to buy text books to sell.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Channy is 29-years-old and married.  She is the mother of two dependent children, one daughter and one son who are under-aged for schooling. 

She has been in rice farming on one hectare of farmland and she plants corn on another hectare.  She also supplements her family’s income by selling custard-apples to feed the family.  Having been in this business for ten years, she is able to earn KHR 10,000 per day.  However, lacking of capital for her business is still the main challenge. 

Channy’s group consists of three members and she is the group leader.  This is the first microloan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisonFund.  Channy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland.  She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve her living’s status.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Felecite

texts.en:
Felecite is 50 years old.  She is married and has 8 children between the ages of 3 and 26 years old.  She has been a rice farmer for 8 years.  She has requested a Kiva loan to use to pay for her labor costs.  She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs to support her rice production.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 35 year old married man with five children living in Kyenjojo -Uganda.  He works in the transport business and has been in this business for four years.  He started as a hired driver and later bought his own taxi which for which he has paid half of the cost.  

He has problems with high fuel and transportation costs.  He has a personal goal of building a permanent house and business goal of expanding his business into new market areas.  Kenneth needs the loan to complete paying for the car.

loans.use: to complete paying for the car.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 48 years old and married with 6 children, ages 12 through 28 years.  She runs a Cookery shop at Kandeh town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone.  Two of her children are currently attending school.

She's been in this business for 15 years and sells local food preparation like cooked rice, cassava leaves and fry soup at her house.  She also earns income from the sales of a petty trading business.  She says her business is doing well because more customers are coming to buy early in the morning and the food is completely sold everyday.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more rice, tomatoes, salt, Maggie, charcoal and onions.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and educate her children.  In the future, she would like to open a restaurant.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, tomatoes, salt, Maggie, charcoal and onions.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 47 year old business lady who she is married with three children.  She has been selling potatoes for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Susan will use the loan to buy more sacks of potatoes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.  Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for storage of her potatoes and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 35 ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants âgés de trois et dix ans qui vont tous les deux à l'école. elle a une alimentation dans un quartier de la ville depuis 05 ans dans laquelle elle vend du pain, chocolat, beurre, bonbon, biscuit, et également de la boisson. elle voudrai avec ce crédit acheté 30 casiers afin d'augmenter ses revenus qui lui permettront plus tard de mieux subvenir aux besoins d'éducation de ses enfants.
