His goal is to improve his crops in order to earn more income and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Aged 31 years old, Chan is also a father of two dependent kids. One of his children is in grade one and another one is in grade three in the public school in the community. To earn a living, and especially to take care of both of his children, he raises pigs for resale, and his wife works at the factory. He has been engaged in this business for eleven years and is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Chan's group consists of two members, and he is the group leader. He is a fourth loan cycle client and the other group member is a second loan cycle client. Chan has completely paid back the past three loans, which have helped him to maintain his business and to keep his children in school. 

Now he and the other group member are seeking a new loan. Chan will use his loan portion to buy more piglets for raising. He hopes that his pigs will be fattened up so as to sell for a good price to make more income. By doing so, he can support his children's tuition fees up to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising.

loans.name: Chanthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthoeurn, 29, is a married mother of three children, one of whom is in school while the remaining two are not yet old enough to attend. Rice farming on one hectare of farmland is the family's main source of income, but Chanthoeurn and her husband also increase their income by working for others in their spare time. They have been involved in these activities for seven years, earning about 17,000 KHR per day.

Chanthoeurn's main challenge is the fruitless crop yield caused by the drought. To tackle this challenge, she has formed a group of three to seek her fourth loan with VisionFund. The past loans, all repaid, have enabled her to set aside some money to buy additional equipment for her family's usage and maintain the needs of her children. Chanthoeurn will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She expects to have greater crop yields so she can earn more income to support her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fee for her farmland.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 39 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is married, with three children.

She is engaged in the Ready To Wear business with different clothing products. She has had this business for almost four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stocks of clothes for her business.

She has been a member of PMPC for almost two months. In the future, she really hopes to be successful in her business by the help of our cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, a 33-year-old married mother of five, lives in the Philippines where for the past two years she has been a farmer growing bananas, vegetables, and particularly ampalaya to earn a living, each month earning 3,000.00 PHP.

A new member of GDMPC, Edna has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Prado Group

texts.en:
Isael is in her early 30s.  She is married, with three children who go to school.  

Isael has had a business of selling rice, wheat flour, salt, beans, and maize flour for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy some kilos of beans and sugar, to pay school fees and household expenses, and to pay rent for her shop.  She has repaid all her loans successfully. 

She hopes for a loan to increase her stocks of sugar, salt, wheat flour, and some kilos of beans for her business.  Her dream is one day to be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, “Prado,” which has 16 members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, salt, wheat flour, and some kilos of beans.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 38 years old and married to Odelyn.  They help each other to make their life better. 

Jayson has been engaged in farming for ten years. He is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm to be able to sustain the needs of his family. 

In the future, Jayson hopes that his farming business will be expand, so that he can meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine lives in Jermuk town with her husband, her mother and her 8-year-old daughter. 

Kristine is a teacher at the local school, but her salary is not enough to cover the family's costs. About four years ago Kristine and her husband decided to start raising cattle, which would ensure an increased income for the family. 

Now Kristine would like to increase the number of cattle; she plans to purchase two cows and a calf. This will bring additional income for agriculture, which is important for Kristine to improve her household conditions and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a calf.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has four children. Josephine is 55 years old and resides at Bunawan, Calamba. 

Josephine owns farm land, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been eight years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 43-year-old businessman. He is married to Penina, who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with two children. 

He has been selling cereals for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loan successfully. Martin will use the loan to buy more stock of dry maize and beans. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry maize and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Elma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elma has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonarda Yamileth

texts.es: Leonarda de 30 años de edad, casada, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella labora para MINED la haya en Juigalpa Chontales, es una persona trabajadora, responsable, quien con esfuerzos propios y a base de creditos que le ha dado Afodenic ha realizado mejoras en su vivienda, por lo que quiere ser beneficiada con los Financiamientos que emite Kiva para continuar mejorando su vivienda ya que tiene proyectado realizar un porche y de esta manera dar mejor presentacion a la misma.  tien un hijo de 12 añso el cual estudia y su sueño es ver a su hijo preparado para que salga adelante en su futuro.
texts.en: Leonarda, 30, is married. Her husband helps her with the household expenses.  She works for MINED in Juigalpa Chontales.  She is a hardworking, responsible person, who thanks to her own effort and the loans microfinance partner Afodenic has given her has made improvements to her home.  She wants to benefit from Kiva's help in order to make further improvements, since she wants to build a porch and thereby make the house look better.  She has a 12-year-old son, who is a student.  Her goal is to prepare her son for a better life in the future.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 38 years old, married to Charles and blessed with two children age 16 and 13 years. 

She runs a shop where she sells a variety of goods. She started this business five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more bales of baking flour and maize flour, crates of eggs and bars of soap for sale. 

The profit she earns from her business will be ploughed back to her business. Her dream is to see her business expand into a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of baking flour and maize flour, crates of eggs and  bar soap for sale.

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en:
Garegin is involved in beekeeping. He started this business four years ago and now keeps 37 beehives. Garegin has applied for this loan to increase the number of beehives he keeps. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 12 colonies of bees and 6 beehives. This will allow Garegin to gather more honey and get more income from its sales. 

Garegin is 25. He lives with his 45-year-old mother, Alvira. Development of beekeeping is absolutely vital for this young man to have a stable income and provide better living conditions for his own family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for colonies of bees and beehives

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 45 years old and a business man; he is married to Elizabeth who is a business lady.  They are blessed with four children. He has been running a medical laboratory for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Douglas will use the loan to buy equipment for his lab. 


With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to open another lab branch and a health clinic.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his lab.

loans.name: Gemina

texts.en:
Gemina is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gemina is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Gemina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Gemina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gemina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jesebel

texts.en:
Jesebel is 55 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jesebel has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Jesebel requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and other equipment for fishing.

Jesebel has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jesebel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 27 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Judelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Judelyn has been raising livestock for four years and also earns additional income from vegetable retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more metal to weld

loans.name: Jeresom

texts.en:
Jeresom is married with six children in addition to one dependant for whom he pays school fees.

Jeresom is a cattle trader and does farming to supplement the income from the cow's milk with the sale of his surplus crop yields. With the income, he has managed to buy land and take his children to good schools. He is compensating for his lack of education to educate his children. He works very hard to provide all the necesities of his house hold.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Las Heroinas De Labranza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Heroínas de Labranza” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; verdulería, venta de remedios, confección de ropa, minimarket, tejidos, venta de adornos, almacén, venta de ropa, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Teresa, tesorera del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la última fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un poleron de color negro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto y usa unos aros grandes ce color plata.
Ella se dedica al rubro de comerciante específicamente a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa de cama como sabanas, desde hace 3 años. Se desempeña en sus labores de lunes a domingo, atiende en su casa y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en bodegas donde compra fardos de ropa y los productos de belleza los compra por catálogos, a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa y productos de belleza.
Unas de las metas de Teresa en su negocio, es tener un negocio estable donde pueda vender ropa de toda clase y agregar venta de perfumes, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Teresa vive junto a su esposo y 4 hijos de 12, 9, 5 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son continuar con el negocio y de contar con mas recursos en el hogar, porque los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de  darles un buen pasar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha a prendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Las Heroínas de Labranza.  It is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who devote themselves to different lines of work.  Among the lines of work are selling vegetables, selling medicine, making clothes, a mini-market, knitted goods, selling decorations, a store, selling clothes, and providing services, among others.  All of the members are from the city of Temuco.

Teresa is the treasurer of the communal bank.  In the photo she is standing in the last row, second from the right.  She has on a black jacket, and her hair is dark brown.  She is wearing it down, and she has on large silver colored earrings. 

She has been selling beauty products and bedding like sheets for three years.  She works from Monday through Sunday.  She sees to her business at home, and she arranges her schedule according to her availability.  She buys her merchandise, bales of clothing, at warehouses.  She buys the beauty products by catalogs.  She gets them at low prices, which is cost-effective.  She will use the loan to buy bales of clothes and beauty products.

One of Teresa’s goals for her business is to have a stable business where she is able to sell all types of clothes and add the sale of perfumes.  She wants to do this in order to generate greater income.  This way she can choose to have a better quality of life.

Teresa lives with her husband and four children, ages 12, 9, 5, and 3.  Her dreams on a personal level are to continue with the business and to have more resources at home.  This is because the children are growing, and while they are growing the need to give them a good life also grows.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza.  It will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that the trainings have been essential for her business and for her personal development.  She has learned to organize and distribute her income and investments in a better way.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  On the outskirts there are a series of lakeside resorts (Pucon, Villarica) and striking native flora and fauna concentrated in the nearby natural parks. Half of the Mapuche people, an indigenous group in Chile, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is 24 years old and a single businessman. He has been selling shoes for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Evanson will use the loan to buy more stock of shoes. 


With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his siblings. His hopes and dreams are to open a  real shoe shop and support his parents.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
Lolie is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Lolie is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Lolie requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise and sell.

Lolie has been raising livestock for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lolie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 29 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Marigen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Marigen has been buying and selling livestock for four years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Meme

texts.en:
Meme is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Meme is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Meme has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Meme requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials.

Meme has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Meme would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Roselanie

texts.en:
Roselanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Roselanie has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Roselanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to repair her family home and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She rears poultry, a practice she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of  25,000 KES. 

Rosemary is requesting her second loan for 22,000 KES, which she will use to buy more chicks and feeds. Her profit will be invested into her business. Her dream is to be a renown supplier of chicken products.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for rearing and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Janet is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to buy more livestock.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a native-bags retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more native bags to sell.

Nelyn has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Nelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more native bags to sell.

loans.name: Mavis Precilla

texts.en:
Mavis Precilla is from D'ban, Calamba. She is 30 years old. Mavis Precilla is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Mavis Precilla is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Mavis Precilla has been in her business for 2 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mavis Precilla is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This year, Mavis Precilla joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Aventura Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AVENTURA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Serafina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, cosméticos de catalogo, tienda de barrio, vende ropa americana, elaboración de mantas de hilo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Serafina es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa americana; da a conocer que  este emprendimiento fue adquirido hace años, cuando ayudaba a su hermana; con sus ahorros logro comprar un fardo de ropa y ese fue su capital para iniciar el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de mercadería (compra de ropa americana) mismo que adquirirá de los puestos aduaneros y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  capacitación.
texts.en:
The Aventura communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Alto, Lima.   It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Serafina is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied.  They include selling clothes, cosmetics by catalog, a neighborhood store, selling American clothes, and making blankets from yarn.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen like Serafina.  She says this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who went to her house.

She currently has a business selling American clothes.  She says that she acquired this venture years ago when she helped her sister.  With her savings she managed to buy a bale of clothes, and this was her capital to start the business.

The loan she will now take out is to buy merchandise (to buy American clothes).  She will get the clothes at the customs posts, and she will later sell them at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the trainings.

loans.use: to buy American clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and a mixed crop farmer; he is married to Margaret who is a farmer. Their marriage is blessed with four children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Tessie is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Tessie has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Tessie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Tessie would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is 42 years old and has four girls and two boys. She sells coconuts at the market. Her sales stand is located at a strategic point. This is her first loan with Yehu. 

Mariamu is going to use the loan to purchase coconuts for sale. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is requesting this loan because she does not have enough working capital. She is going to use the proceeds as working capital. She wishes to improve her quality of life and that of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Juba.  Primo runs  a fruit selling business, which she has been doing for two years. 

Primo is requesting a loan for 1,200 SDG, which she will use to purchase bananas and other fruits.  She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.  In the future, she wants to expand her business. Her  major challenges include high prices in the market.

loans.use: to purchase fruits.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 40 years old, single, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Alona runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years.  She sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar, soap, and soft drinks.   

Alona is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy additional items to sell in her general store.  In the future, Alona would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Ep Teresamira Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bugegate, représentante du groupe d'enseignants, elle est enseignante (monitrice) dans une école primaire Teresamira, qui  bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Elle est entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 48 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants. En dehors de son service, elle fait de petit commerce de pommes de terre pour accroitre son portefeuille. Ca fait longtemps que son mari est décédé. Elle commença son affaire avec son fonds propre reçu de son salaire. Plus tard, elle trouva le soutien de mutuel de crédit. Elle vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de Hekima. Avec ce nouveau cycle de crédit, elle va acheter 15 sacs de pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son programme  de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
Bugegate, the representative of the teacher's group, is a teacher (instructor) in a primary school in Teresamira, which benefits from loans from IMF Hekima. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, 48 years of age, widowed and the mother of 6 children.

She sells potatoes outside of work, to increase her wallet. Her husband died a long time ago. She started her business with her own funds, taken from her salary. Later on, she found support through group loans. She has completed 2 loan cycles with Hekima's program. She will use this new loan to buy 15 bags of potatoes. She would like to thank Hekima for its micro financing program for teachers.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of potatoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a business selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines. Maria requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell. Maria has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Kwame Nkuruma Group

texts.en:
Amedius is in his late twenties and is married. He has been selling food items like rice, wheat and maize flour, beans, sugar, and salt for about 2.5 years now. He is truly hardworking. He works from 6am to 10pm and is able to make a really good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more food items for his business, like beans, a sack of rice, and wheat flour. He has paid back his previous loans successfully. He wants a loan to add more rice, some kilos of beans, wheat flour, maize flour, and different kinds of soaps to his inventory. His dream is to be a big trader.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Kwame Nkuruma, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: La Sra. Viviana  tiene 44 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 18, 14 y 23 años, ella se dedica al  comercio de chatarras ella tiene su puesto de acopio que se encuentran la zona  6 de agosto de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Viviana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que está haciendo construir su casita negocio, su  razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  quiere mejorar los ambientes de su hogar, la Sra. Viviana  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que no es estable ya que es según la temporada  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material de construcción  para el mejoramiento de su hogar, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera genera más ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Viviana is 44 years old and married with 3 children aged 23, 18, and 14. She sells scrap metal at her collecting post in the August 6th Zone  of Cochabamba city. This will be her first loan with this institution.

Viviana will use the loan to purchase construction material to build a small building for her business and improve her home.  Her main reason for taking out this loan is to improve conditions in her home.

Viviana faces challenges in her business which is not stable, since it varies by seasons. She will also use this loan to continue buying construction materials to improve her home. Her desire is to have a stable and profitable business and in this way, to generate more income with the goal of improving her quality of life.

loans.use: buy construction material to build a stall and improve her home.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is involved in agriculture. He keeps cows and chickens, and he grows a variety of fruit trees. Artur would like to develop a pig-breeding business, for which he has applied for this loan. He intends to use the loan to purchase pigs and forage to feed them. Artur lives with his wife, Hermine, and 4-year-old daughter, Ani. Artur serves at the local military unit as a squadron commander. He hopes to increase his income after expansion of the farm, which will allow him to invest in further development of his agriculture business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and forage

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: Nelfa works hard to support her family. Nelfa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nelfa requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Nelfa has been in this business for nine years now. In the future, Nelfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl, esta casado y tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son independientes y solo vive con el menor en casa de sus familiares ocupando una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió solamente hasta la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la confección de ropa de ambos sexos (camisas, pantalones, chamarras), trabajando por más de diez horas  al día, pues debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar otra maquina de costura, pues tiene unos pedidos grandes  y desea mejorar sus ingresos. Esta actividad de confección de ropa  es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
El sueño de Raúl es adquirir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Raúl’s married and has three children two of which are already independent; he lives just with his youngest one in a house of his relatives occupying a room with adobe walls and dirt floor.  The house is located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Ingenio zone.

He only attended elementary school and earns income at present making clothes for both genders (shirts, pants, jackets).  He works more than ten hours a day because he must cover his family’s food, school and basic utility costs.

He needs the loan to buy another sewing machine because he has large pending orders and he would like to improve his income.  This clothes-making activity is the only source of income he has.

Raúl’s dream is to acquire a house in the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to provide more comfort for his family.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia María Rosario es madre y padre para sus dos hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatos, ropa, juguetes y también se dedica a la enseñanza nivel primario, la socia trae ropa, juguetes de la ciudad de Tacna, Desaguadero, puno y Lima, ella vende sus productos dependiendo a la temperada como por ejemplo en navidad vende juguetes y el resto del año vende ropa y otras cosas más.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como blusas, casacas, polos y otras cosas más. Su sueño de la señora es abrir una tienda de venta de ropa y juguetes. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario belongs to the communal bank "Ricchary Cusco."  This bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Maria Rosario is a single parent with two children; she alternates her daily activities with her business selling shoes, clothing, and toys.  She is also an elementary school educator.  She brings clothing and toys from the cities of Tacna, Desaguadero, Puno and Lima.  She sells her products according to the season, for example, during the Christmas season she sells toys, and during the rest of the year she sells clothing and other items.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as: blouses, jackets, polo shirts and other items.  Her dream is to open a store where she could sell clothing and toys.

Maria Rosario thanks those who are making it possible for her to achieve her dream through these means, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as: blouses, jackets, polo shirts and other items

loans.name: Juan Gualberto

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Juan, él pertenece al banco “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El socio es un joven trabajador de la municipalidad de su distrito, pero aparte de su trabajo en la institución pública, también tiene un pequeño volquete y con el realiza servicio de transporte de materiales para la construcción como arena, piedras o ladrillos.
El socio necesita hacerle un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, y para ello invertirá su préstamo, y le comprará repuestos y accesorios para mantenerlo operativo.
El gran sueño de Juan es poder comprar un vehículo mas grande para hacerlo trabajar en su actividad alterna y así percibir mejores ingresos.
Juan agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse con su actividad altenativa.
texts.en:
This member is Señor  Juan. He belongs to the “Ahorro es progreso” ["Saving is progress"] bank in the Saylla district of the city of Cusco, Peru. He is a young local municipal worker, but apart from his work in the public institution, he also has a small truck with which he provides a transportation service for construction materials such as sand, stone, and bricks.
His vehicle needs general maintenance, and it is for this purpose that he will invest this loan. He will purchase spare parts and accessories to keep his vehicle in working order.
Juan's great dream is to be able to buy a larger vehicle for this second job in order to make a better income.
Juan thanks Kiva for allowing him to develop his second job.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for his vehicle.

loans.name: Nuestro Sueño Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Nuestro Sueño” está conformado por 20 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, feriantes, artesanía, venta de leña, repostería, tejidos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Rony, presidente del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la última fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color café oscuro y lleva puesto un gorro de lana de color azul.
El se dedica al rubro de vendedor ambulante de limones y zanahorias, desde hace 2 meses. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7.30ºº hasta las 18.30ºº horas, en las ferias de su ciudad.
Su mercadería la compra en bodegas y algunas veces en supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará  mallas de limones.
Una de las metas de Rony en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de tener un puesto fijo en la feria para trabajar más tranquilo, para generar mayores ingresos,  así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Rony vive junto a su esposa y 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años. Sus sueños a nivel personal es llegar a tener un taller de muebles en su casa, ya que se desempeña bastante bien dentro de este rubro, pero le faltan las herramientas esenciales para comenzar, además existe la necesidad de contar con más recursos en el hogar, porque los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar.
El se encuentra muy contento y agradecido de  la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The name of this Community Bank is 'Nuestra Sueño'. There are twenty members, all with businesses such as clothes sales, stallholders, crafts, firewood sales, baker, weaving, services etc. They all live in the town of Temuco.

Rony is the President. He can be seen in the photo standing in the back row second from the right and wearing a dark brown jacket and a blue wool hat. He has earned his living for the last two years selling lemons and carrots in the various local markets. He works from 7:30am to 6:30pm. Rony buys the produce in small stores or sometimes in supermarkets at low prices, whichever is more financially beneficial. With the loan he plans to buy bags of lemons.

One of Rony's business goals is to have a permanent stall in the market so that he can have a calmer place in which to work, earn more money, and thus have a better quality of life.

Rony lives with his wife and two children aged 5 and 3. On a personal level his dream is to one day own a furniture workshop in his home as he does well in this line of work. However, he lacks the necessary tools to start this business. As well, he needs to spend more money in the home because his children are growing so he has to provide them with a good start to life.

He is very happy and grateful to have this opportunity with Fondo Esperanza which will allow him to invest in his business. Commenting on his Community Bank, he says that the members communicate well with each other. As well, the training provided has given him the opportunity to learn new sales and accounting techniques.

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucanía. The town is located 670 km south of Santiago, the capital of Chile. In the surrounding areas are lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica), and fascinating native plants and animals.

loans.use: To buy bags of lemons

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,a la vez la socia es profesora cesante siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante con su negocio,la socia vende la ropa a sus amistades y familiares quienes le solicitan.


La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar casacas al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Luz belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She alternates her daily chores with a business buying and selling clothes.  She’s been in business for some time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She’s also a retired teacher which is how she’s able to get ahead with her business.  She sells clothes to her friends and family members who request it.  She’s asking for the loan to buy coats at wholesale.  She thanks those who share her dream through this means and commits to make her installments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Joaquin Alberto

texts.es:
Joaquín, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, este negocio lo aprendió con unos amigos, el vive en casa familiar junto con su esposa quien se dedica como costurera fabricando prendas de vestir, actualmente no poseen hijos.

El solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de langostas, pescado variado, camarones, ya que son los que comercializa en el mercado, el préstamo ayudará para expandirse más en la zona ya que obtendrá los recursos económicos para invertir en producto fresco, obtendrá la oportunidad de crear clientes nuevos y mejorar sus ganancias.

El objetivo de él es trabajar de la mano con préstamos, para poder desarrollarse en el negocio, una vez desarrollado espera poder trabajar con los fondos propios y haber dejado un buen récord crediticio.
texts.en:
Joaquín has a business selling seafood.  He learned this trade with some friends.  He lives in the family home along with his wife, who is a dressmaker.  They currently have no children.

Joaquín is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of lobsters, shrimp and a variety of fish, because these are the products he sells in the market.  This loan will help him to expand in the area, because he will have the financial resources to invest in fresh products.  This will give him the opportunity to attract new customers and increase his earnings.

His goal is to work with these loans so that he can develop his business.  Once his business is developed he hopes to be able to work with his own funds, having established a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy lobsters, shrimp and a variety of fish

loans.name: Damaris Marbeli

texts.es: La señora Damaris habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, ella junto a su familia se esfuerzan mucho dia a dia para salir adelante y tener mejores condiciones de vida, con este nuevo prestamo doña Damaris comprara parte de Materiales de Construccion para terminar su casa: Comprara Bloques, Hierro, Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Estrivos, Laminas de Zinc y Perlines, Damaris Labora como Docente en un centro educativo y su dificultad es no recoger de una sola vez el dinero necesario para contruir su casa, Gracias a Afodenic y Fondo Kiva por ayudarla a cumplir su sueño y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe.  She and her family strive daily to get ahead and have better living conditions.  With this new loan Damaris will buy some of the building materials and supplies needed to finish her house.  She will buy concrete blocks, rebar, cement, sand, gravel, straps, metal sheets and purlines.

Damaris works as a teacher at a school and her problem is being unable to gather all the money she needs at one time to build her house.  Thanks to Afodenic and Kiva funds for helping her reach her and her children’s’ dream.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: 19 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “19 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas de chompas, costura de busos, costura de mandiles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de aguayos; cuenta que  este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su capital (compra de telas) mismo que adquirirá las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará elaborará a en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: The communal association "19 de Julio" will begin the first cycle of Pro Mujer, as a part of the Focal Center of Los Andes. It has 6 members and it is directed by a board presided by Hilda. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied: knitting sweaters, sewing sweatpants, sewing aprons. The loan they will get will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, including Hilda. She says it's the first time she is a member of Pro Mujer, and entered through an invitation of a promoter who went by her house to invite her. Currently she has a business of sewing aguayos (a Bolivian piece of cloth used for adornment). She says she started this business out of her own initiative. The loan she asking for now, is to increase her capital (buying fabrics), which she will acquire in the distributing stores and after producing them, she will sell them in the fairs of the city El Alto. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Tirsa Carolina

texts.es: Tirsa de 35 años de edad, habita en Juigalpa Chontale, tiene dos hijos, uno de 12 y el otro de 9 años ellos estudian su educacion primaria, es comerciante, con esfuerzo propio y con creditos ante Afodenic ha venido creciendo en el ambito social y economicamente, actualmente se dedica a dos negocios como es venta de tajadas y Pulperia de donde obtiene sus ingresos para la manutencion de sus hijos, y los gastos del hogar, tambien recibo ayuda por parte del papá de sus hijos, esta Señora es muy responsable, en los creditos anteriores ha demostrado cumplimiento y moral de pago.  Solicita su 5to. credito para invertirlo en mejorar el porche de su vivienda y asi brindar mejores condiciones a su familia y a sus clientes que la visitan.  Anela ver su negocio grande y que sus hijos esten llenos de salud al igual que ella.
texts.en:
Tirsa, 35, lives in Juigalpa Chontale.  She has two children, a 12-year-old and a 9-year-old, who attend elementary school.  She’s a merchant.  With her own efforts and with Afodenic loans she’s been growing socially and economically.  She currently has two businesses: she sells fried sliced bananas and she has a grocery store producing income to support her children and to pay household expenses.  She also gets help from her children’s father.  

This lady is very responsible.  She demonstrated responsibility and good payment behavior with her previous loan.  She’s now requesting her 5th loan to improve her porch thus providing better conditions for her family and for the customers who visit her.  She hopes her business will be big and that she and her children will be full of good health.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene la edad de 66 años, habita en Juigalpa Chontales, es comerciante, a su edad se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos basicos para el sustento de su hogar, no tiene hijos que mantener todos son mayores de edad; se dedica a esta labor desde hace 15 años, por lo que es una señora sola y muy trabajadora, le gusta estar en actividad laboral.  Solicita su credito para aumentar su inventario y de esta manera suplir las necesidades de sus clientes que le demandan sus productos. Su mayor proposito es estar con salud y que no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en: María, 66, lives in Juigalpa Chontales.  She’s a merchant.  At her age she works selling vegetables and basic grains to support her home.  She does not have children to support; they are all adults.  She’s been in this business for 15 years; she is a very hardworking woman who lives alone and likes being involved in this type of work.  She’s asking for a loan to increase her inventory in order to meet customer demand.  Her greatest goal is to be healthy and to have daily bread.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, se dedica a la venta y compra de ropa nueva, vive en casa propia con una de sus hijas, también vive con su esposo quien es agricultor, el negocio de gloria es ofrecer prendas de vestir para todas las edades de ambos sexos, lo hace con la ayuda de su hija, su horario es de siete de la mañana a una de la tarde de lunes a domingo.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de ropa nueva para niños ya sean trajes, vestidos, ropa interior, que sean del uso de niños y niñas, este crédito ayudará a que su inventario se fortalezca para atender mejor a la clientela, sus ingresos para su familia podrán ir mejorando, espera que también su esposo tenga buenos resultados en su trabajo esta temporada, pues esto ayudará a su mejor prosperidad; su aspiración es comprarse un puesto fijo en el mercado donde pueda atender  mejor a los clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria works buying and selling new clothing. She lives in her own house with one of her daughters. She also lives with her husband, who is a farmer. Gloria's business is offering items of clothing for men and women of all ages. She does this with the help of her daughter, and her schedule is from seven in the morning until one in the afternoon from Monday to Sunday.

She is asking for a loan to be able to make a purchase of new clothing for children such as suits, dresses, and underclothes for both boys and girls. This loan will help strengthen her inventory to be better able to wait on her customers. Her income for her family will be able to improve, and she also hopes her husband will have good results from his work this season because that will help their prosperity. Her dream is buy a permanent stall in the market where she'll be able to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy suits, dresses, and underclothes.

loans.name: Nancy Hortencia

texts.es: Nancy vive en el Fortín sector urbano norte de Guayaquil, ella es una muestra clara de superación ya que hace 7 años inicio una tienda de abarrotes, pequeña pero surtida para atraer a la clientela, cuando la empezó su vivienda era de caña en la actualidad es de cemento gracias a su trabajo y al banco D-miro quien fue la primera institución que confió en ella y le brindo ayuda. Su jornada diaria empieza desde las 5:30 de la mañana ya que vende legumbres y tiene que comprarlas frescas en el mercado de transferencia de vivieres, luego abre su negocio y no cierra hasta las 10 de la noche, no tiene necesidad ya que su esposo le ayuda con la atención al público. Los productos que más vende son las legumbres, frutas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollos, granos, colas, leches, embutidos etc., mismo productos que comprara con le préstamo para surtir. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su casa ya que le gustaría abrir un bazar al lado para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nancy lives in El Fortín, an urban sector in north Guayaquil.  She’s a good example of personal improvement since she opened a small but well-stocked grocery store seven years ago.  When she started out her house was made of sugarcane stalks and now it’s cement thanks to her work and to Banco D-Miro which was the first institution that trusted her and offered help.

Her work day starts at 5:30am because since she sells vegetables she has to buy them fresh at the foodstuffs market.  She then opens her store and doesn’t close until 10 at night.  She has no needs since her husband helps her tend to customers.  What she sells the most is vegetables, fruit, rice, sugar, oil, chickens, grains, soft-drinks, milk, cured meats, etc. which are the products she’ll buy with the loan to stock up.  Her future goal is to enlarge her house because she’d like to open a clothing store next door to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es: El señor Edgard junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos sueñan con tener mejores condiciones de vida y completar su casa de habitacion, a Edgard se le complica mucho a justar el dinero de una sola vez para sufragar sus gastos de la casa solo completa para los ingresos mensuales del hogar, alimentacion, educacion de sus hijos, pero con este nuevo financiamiento comprara parte de los materiales que necesita para terminar la casa en este caso el baño: Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Piedrin, Ceramica, Agradecido con Afodenic quien a travez de Fondos Kiva lo han apoyado mucho a cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Edgard, his life companion and their children dream with having better living conditions and to finish building their house.  It’s very difficult for Edgar to gather together all the money he needs at once to cover the cost of his house; he’s only able to have enough to pay household monthly expenses like food and his children’s schooling costs.  But with this new loan he will be able to buy some of the building materials and supplies he needs to finish the house, on this occasion the bathroom.  He’ll get concrete blocks, cement, sand, rebar, gravel and tile.  He thanks Afodenic who through Kiva funds have supported him very much to make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Darlita

texts.en:
Darlita of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, supports her family through a nipa hut making business. She’s 44 years old, a married mom of three kids, who tries her best to earn on her own. 

For three years, she has managed this business, and she earns about PHP 4,500 per month.  She now needs to buy more nipa palm to make roofing materials. 

She joined this year, and she thanks GDMPC microfinance for the loan of PHP 5,000 they provided to her. Darlita desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm to make roofing materials.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 57 years old and married, with four grown children. 

He has raised his family in a village by planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale.   

He doesn't earn enough from that, so he also engages in raising fingerlings to generate additional income. Having no competitors in the area, he aims to raise more fingerlings to sale in the future.  Because he lacks capital, he is asking for an a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy feed and more fingerlings to raise. 

He said that his loan will be a great help for him in working out his plan.  He hopes that he will be successful someday to uplift his famiy's living status and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional fingerlings to raise.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia sigue viviendo en el Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades economicas, ella sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal "RICCHARY CUSCO". 
 
Ella sigue dedicandose al negocio de la construcción pues su especializacion es la fabricación de tejas. Además, ella también tiene un negocio de venta de granos secos como trigo, cebada y maíz.

Ella está oportunidad requiere el prestamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como paja y otros materiales para la construcción y también a va comprar más trigo, arroz y  maíz para vender en su tienda. Ella se compromete a hacer los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en:
Anastacia continues living in Cusco where she carries out her economic activities.  She’s still a member of the “Ricchary Cusco” communal bank.  She continues working in construction and her specialty is manufacturing roofing tiles.  She also has a business selling dry goods like wheat, barley and corn.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more work materials like straw and other building supplies.  She will also buy more wheat, rice and corn to sell in her store.  She commits to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and also to buy more wheat, rice and corn to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chela Luz

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Chela, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven trabajadora, madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, que se sigue dedicando a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, y es con esta actividad que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, Chela en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar insumos como arroz, papas, menestras, granos, aceite y utensilios para la venta de sus alimentos. 
Chela trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para darles a sus hijos una mejor vida, y lo que es más importante, brindarles una mejor educación.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, una mejor educación a sus hijos y por ayudarla con el fortalecimiento de su actividad.
texts.en:
Chela belongs to the “Ahorro es Progreso” (Savings es Progress) communal bank in the city of Cusco-Perú’s Saylla District.  She’s a young worker, mother of two school age children who continues selling food from place to place, an activity with which she’s succeeded in moving her two children forward.  On this occasion, Chela will use the requested loan to buy ingredients like rice, potatoes, vegetables, grains, oil and kitchen supplies for her food sales.  

Chela works very much and sacrifices in order to provide her children with a better life and what’s most important, a better education.  She’s very grateful to Kiva for making it possible for her to give her family a better quality of life, a better education for her children and for helping her to strengthen her activity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jorge Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.Jorge ; el socio continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de laptops,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,el socio a la vez trabaja en una institucion privada el es asesor financiero ,siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante ,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su hijo.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de laptops.
 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Jorge continues selling laptops.  He’s been in this business a good length of time and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it.  At the same time, he’s employed as a financial consultant in a private firm.  This is how he gets ahead.  He’s a responsible, hardworking person who very much wants to continue working for his son.  He requests the loan to buy a pair of laptops.  He thanks those who form part of this dream via this means and commits to make his installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a pair of laptops.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 47 years old and married.  She is blessed with five children, aged 19, 17, 15, 8, and 3 years, respectively. 

She is a tailor, a business she started five years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. Her profit will help her clear her debts as well as expand her business. 

Her dream is to be successful in the business and open a tailoring school.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.ru: Гулзар 36 лет, замужем, заботится и воспитывает 5 детей, младшей из которых 1 год. В 2007 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулзар начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 головы крупного рогатого скота,  4 телят, 10 овец, 1 лошадь,  ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, Гулзар обрабатывает 5,5 га земли, где выращивает многолетние травы и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзар  обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец на откорм. В будущем, Гулзар хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес за счет приобретения породистого скота с целью накопления денег на оплату обучения для 16-летнего сына в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Gulzar is 36 years old, married and taking care and raising five children, the youngest of whom is one years old.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 2007 with an initial sum of 25,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, today her business contains two, four calves, ten sheep and one horse, and the monthly profit from sales of milk and meat products amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).  Gulzar also works on 5.5 hectares of land, where she grows perennial herbs and barley.  In order to further develop her business, Gulzar requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls and sheep for fattening up.  In the future, she wants to increase her farm and expand her business by buying purebred livestock in order to save money and pay for her 16 year-old son's university education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 35 лет, замужем, заботится и воспитывает детей – школьников. В 2005году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Анара начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 головы крупного рогатого скота,  16 овец, 23 козы, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара  обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку высокоудойных телок. В будущем, Анара хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес за счет приобретения породистого скота.
texts.en: Anara is 35 years old, married and taking care and raising her school-age children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 2005 with an initial sum of 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, today her business contains two cows, sixteen sheep and twenty-three goats, and the monthly profit from sales of milk and meat products amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Anara requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows.  In the future, she wants to increase her farm and expand her business by buying purebred livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of three and eight. All of them go to school.

John runs a general store and has been in business for five years. He has one employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 1,200 sdg to purchase sugar, soap and other items for the store. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, John would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high  transportations cost.

John says he is very grateful for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 60 years old and widowed with 8 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Consolacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Consolacion has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Consolacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jesabel

texts.es: La joven Jesabel tiene la edad de 31 años, es soltera, tiene dos hijos la niña de 9 años y el menor de 4, habita en Juigalpa Chontales, es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva de donde obtiene sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia, ha demostrado ser buena paga y muy responsable en los creditos anteriores que ha tenido con Afodenic, actualmente solicita su 11vo. credito para invertirlo en el inventario de sus negocio y ofrecerles variedad a su clientela que demanda sus pruductos, ya que se avecinan las fiestas patrias en nuestra Ciudad de Juigalpa donde la gente compra variedades en lo que es Ropa y zapato asi como tambien el cosmetico se comercializa mucho en esta temporada.  Sueña con ver a sus hijos realizados y crecer en su negocio pues inicio con poco y vendiendo a Domicilio por lo que cabe mencionar que ahora ya tiene productor en existencia en su casa y asi de esta manera atrae mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Jesabel, 31, is a young single woman.  She has two children, a nine-year-old girl and a four-year-old boy.  She lives in Juigalpa Chontales and is a merchant.  She sells cosmetics and new clothes earning income to support her family that way.  

She’s been very responsible with and has shown good repayment behavior with previous Afodenic loans.  She’s currently requesting her 11th loan to buy stock inventory for her business and offer her customers who request her products more variety because the city of Juigalpa’s national festivities are approaching and people buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics a lot during this season.  

She dreams with seeing her children develop and also to grow in her business because she started out with little selling door to door and it’s worth mentioning now that she has product on hand at home which attracts a larger clientele.

loans.use: to supply her business.

loans.name: Aprolyn

texts.en:
Aprolyn is from the city of Dipolog. She is 52 years old and single. 

Aprolyn has a ready-to-wear clothing business. She earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. She is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional clothes to sell. 

She has been a member of Paglaum for one year and four months. In the future, she wants her business to be successful so that as years pass, she can provide for all her wants and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nelinda is 59 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nelinda has a banana-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Nelinda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Nelinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is from Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Regina is married and has three children. To make a living, Regina has been managing a coconut production business for 5 years and earns 1,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Regina joined GDMPC. Regina is requesting a loan of 1,934 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and has 9 children. Letecia is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Letecia is in the agricultural business and raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with two children. Jocelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.
               
Jocelyn is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer.
                                                        
Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to harvest more corn.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her corn crops

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 58 years old and widowed with 9 children.

Linda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Linda has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 23 years and also earns an income from selling charcoal and raising pigs.

Linda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Hilda tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias del hogar con el negocio de venta de papas pues tiene un puesto de venta. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia Hilda solicita el préstamo para comprar papas y granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada y trigo. El sueño de la señora es construir su casa.  

La socia Hilda agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Hilda belongs to the “Ricchary Cusco” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children.  She alternates her daily household chores with selling potatoes; she has a sales stand.  She’s been in this business 17 years and does very well.  Hilda requests the loan to buy potatoes and dry grains like corn, barley and wheat.  Her dream is to build a house.  She thanks those who share her dream via this means and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a gas tank, flour, oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Kimsong's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district of Cambodia, KimSong is a 27-year-old married father of one son, who is dependent on him. 

To support his family, he works as a construction worker and his wife is a garment worker. These are the only jobs that they have. They earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Kimsong leads a group of two as the first loan cycle client to seek a loan. He will use his portion to build a decent pour flush latrine. (A pour flush toilet is like a regular flush toilet except that instead of the water coming from a cistern above, it is poured in by the user.) To build it, Kimsong needs cement, a roof, sand, a latrine bowl and a door. 

He hopes to own a decent latrine in order to promote good health for his family, especially his son.

loans.use: To build a decent pour flush latrine for his family.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and rice. Merly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bignozi 2 Group

texts.fr: Femme âgée de 60ans, Madame Rosalie fait partie d’un groupement qui se nomme « BIGNOZI ». Pour son bon avancement, elle a été nommée par les autres pour les diriger. C’est un groupement constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui ont foi à la terre et qui sont dans ce domaine il y a un moment. Madame Rosalie est mère de 07 enfants. 01 seul est encore sur les bancs d’école. L’ainé a 42ans et le dernier 17ans. Elle est ménagère et cultivatrice, son conjoint exerce la même activité (cultivateur) qu’elle. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 16ans et sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail. Elle veut épargner, devenir une grande revendeuse de céréales à partir de sa production. Elle veut aux cotés de son mari, assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie, age 60, is a member of the group BIGNOZI. She was chosen to be the group leader by the other members to ensure the group’s success. The group consists of men and women who have faith in the land and have substantial experience in their activity. 

Mrs. Rosalie is the mother of seven children aged 17 to 42, one of whom still goes to school. She is a homemaker and farmer, and her husband is a farmer as well. She has been working in this sector for 16 years, and she is seeking this loan to purchase farming equipment.

Her plans are to boost her savings, and to become an important reseller of grains from her own crops. She wants to provide for her family’s well-being together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment.

loans.name: 21 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “21 DE SEPTIEMBRE” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, producción de leche, chofer de taxi, mecánica, producción de queso, producción y venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa (enaguas, mandiles y mantas); cuenta que hace  veinte años que trabaja en esta área dándole buenos réditos, es por eso que en la actualidad ampliará producirá su mercadería.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento ampliación de negocio (compra de tela y máquina) mismo que comprará de las tiendas distribuidoras, posteriormente elaborará los productos y los comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y las comunidades rurales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.
