Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo la hija de Cruza, ella esta vestida de chompa celeste.
texts.en:
The “21st of September” communal bank has begun its 5th cycle of loans with Pro Mujer [Pro-Woman] through the Achacachi Center. The bank is composed of 10 members and is managed by a board of directors with Paulina as President. The businesses the members are involved in vary; among these are clothing sales, milk production, taxi driving, mechanical work, cheese making and the production and sale of potatoes and potato starch. 

Their loan will benefit micro-enterprises including Paulina's. She reports that it has been 3 years since she joined Pro Woman, in response to an invitation by a promoter of the institution who came to her house to invite her. Now, she has a business selling clothing (petticoats, aprons, shawls). She says she has worked in this area for 20 years, producing good returns. That is why she now wishes to expand production of her merchandise.
 
The loan she wishes to take out is to implement the expansion of her business (buying cloth and a sewing machine), which she will purchase from the distribution houses. Then she will make products and sell them in local fairs in the city of El Alto and in surrounding rural communities. This form of work will allow her to generate resources that will help her family to the degree possible. Paulina lives in a common-law union and has 2 children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Woman, she responded that she likes the security.

In the photo accompanying the group, Cruza's daughter may be seen wearing a sky blue sweater.

loans.use: buy cloth and a sewing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elvia Maribel

texts.es:
La socia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal "RICCHARY CUSCO"; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de peluches, ella vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m sus productos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de peluches. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar peluches al por mayor que traerá de la ciudad de Arequipa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Elvia continues in the “Ricchary Cusco” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She continues selling stuffed toys.  She sells her products from 9am until 8pm.  Her dream is to expand the stuffed toy business.  She’s requesting the loan to buy stuffed toys at wholesale that she’ll bring from the city of Arequipa.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,perfumes,cremas y esmaltes de uñas,la socia tambien vende carteras y zapatos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza,carteras y zapatos. ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Ella sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal "RICCHARY CUSCO"; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia solicita el credito para comprar cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gladys continues selling beauty products like lipstick, perfume, creams, nail polish; she also sells purses and shoes.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell beauty products, purses and shoes.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  She continues being a member of the “Ricchary Cusco” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She is requesting the loan to buy creams, perfume and lipstick.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Remonda

texts.en:
Remonda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Remonda has been in this business for four years. Remonda earns more income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Remonda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy addditional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза проживает в районе Спитамен. Ей 27 лет.У нее трое детей.Она занимается пошивом национальных платьев.Наргиза очень пунктуальная и трудолюбивая женщина поэтому у нее много постоянных клиентов.А ее муж работает в Российской Федерации и у него есть постоянная работа. Накопив деньги они купили новый дом, в этом году они переехали на новый дом и хотят построить новую кухню и баню.Наргиза просить 10000 сомони для покупки строй материалов.Она и ее муж стараются улучшить условия жилья для своих детей и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Nargiza lives in the Spitamen district.  She is 27 years old and has three children.  She is involved in sewing national dresses.  Nargiza is a very punctual and hardworking woman, and this is why she has many clients.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation and has a permanent job there.  Having saved money, they bought a new house, moved there this year and want to build a new kitchen and sauna.  Nargiza is requesting 10,000 somoni to purchase construction materials.  She and her husband try to improve the living conditions for their children and rely on your support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jhon Richard

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de peluches pero también ahora está vendiendo joyas como collares, aretes y pulseras. Además, él también se dedica a la venta de zapatillas de marca, el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el local de venta de peluches y zapatillas. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar peluches y zapatillas. El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota. 

El socio sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal "Ricchary Cusco" de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Jhon continues with the business of selling stuffed toys but es now also selling jewelry like necklaces, earrings and bracelets.  He also sells brand-name slippers.  His dream is to expand and improve his stuffed toy and slipper sales locale.  He’s requesting the loan to buy stuffed toys and slippers.  He’s happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.  He still belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchary Cusco” communal bank in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys and slippers.

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 40 años es madre y padre para sus tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Sicuani y  vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se sigue dedicándose a la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada, habas y papa, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos secos como maíz y papa. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos secos y cereales. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Madai is currently 40-years-old and is both mother and father to her three children.  She was born in the city of Sicuani and still lives there.  She continues selling dry grains like corn, barley, lima beans and potatoes.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more dry grains like corn and potatoes.  She’s been in this business 17 years now and does very well.  Her dream is to expand the dry grain and cereal business.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy dry grains and cereals.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Karina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven y soltera trabajadora de la institución pública, Karina esta accediendo a hacer un curso de pos grado de la profesión universitaria que estudió, para mantenerse actualizada académicamente, por ello en esta ocasión invertirá su préstamo  para pagar su educación.  
Karina está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse profesionalmente.
texts.en: Karina belongs to the “Ahorro es Progreso” (Savings is Progress) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú’s Saylla district.  She’s a single young woman working for a public institution.  Karina wants to take a post-graduate course in the professional field she studied at university in order to stay up-to-date academically so will use the present loan to pay for her education.  Karina is very happy and grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to develop professionally.

loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate course.

loans.name: Rapiya

texts.ru: Рапие 65 лет, вдова, имеет 5 детей. В 1997 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Рапия начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 1 голову дойной коровы с приплодом,  8 овец, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рапия обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец на откорм. В будущем, Рапия хочет расширить свой бизнес за счет ремонта и увеличения сарая.
texts.en: Rapiya is 65 years old, a widow and has five children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1997 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring and eight sheep, and the monthly profit from sales of milk and meat products amounts to about 4,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Rapiya requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy ten sheep for fattening up.  In the future, she wants to expand her business by repairing and expanding her barn.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Edwin, él pertenece al banco “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El socio es casado  y tiene 1 hijo pequeño; Edwin se dedica a administrar su restaurante donde principalmente vende chicharrones de cerdo, como la mayoría de comercios de este distrito caracterizado por la venta de este delicioso potaje.
El socio necesita capitalizar su comercio porque se aproxima una de las festividades más representativas de su distrito y en la cual todos los productores de chicharrones de esta comunidad están invitados para vender sus productos, así que comprará carne de cerdo y cerveza para dicho festival.
El gran sueño de Edwin es poder construir su casa para ofrecerle mayor estabilidad a su familia.
 Edwin agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y mantenerse con su actividad y apoyarlo con su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin belongs to the bank “Ahorro es Progreso” in the district of Saylla in the city of Cusco in Peru.  He is married and has one young son.  He runs a restaurant where he mainly sells chicharrones, a fried snack made from pork. This delicious dish is very popular throughout the district.

He needs to invest in his business because a major festival is about to take place in his district.  All of the chicharrón vendors in the community are invited to sell their products.  He will buy pork and beer for this festival.

His greatest dream is to be able to build his own house so he can provide more stability for his family.  He thanks Kiva for helping him to develop and maintain his business and thus be able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy pork and beer.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo Antonio de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, sus dos hijos y tres nietos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de granos básicos, frijol y maíz, ya tiene mas de veinticinco años de experiencia en el rubro, que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y además obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y está cercano a su residencia, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Domingo es un hombre emprendedor dispuesto a salir adelante y siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar y mantener el éxito, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital para la compra de insumos por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, abono, algunas herramientas de trabajo etc. Domingo es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo Antonio, 49, lives with his life companion, their two children and three grand-children in his own house.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing basic grains, beans and corn.  He has more than 25 years’ experience in this line of work which allows him to maintain the quality of his work and also to obtain better harvests.  His field is located in an area of intense agricultural activity near his place of residence.  He sells in all the neighboring areas and has a large clientele because people know that everything he sells is of quality and at affordable prices but above all because of the excellent service.

Domingo is an enterprising man who is ready to get ahead and is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will allow him to reach and keep success.  During the present planting season he wants to increase production but lacks sufficient capital to buy the necessary supplies which is why he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, manure, some work tools, etc.

Domingo is very responsible and has good payment references.  He assures that he’ll be able to pay the loan while at the same time provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Dehkonboy

texts.ru: Дехконбой мужчина в возрасте 41 года,отец четверых детей, женат.Его жена домохозяйка,занимается домом и детьми но в свободное время по возможности старается помогать своему мужу. Сам Дехконбой полностью занимается куплей и продажей мелко рогатого скота.Этим видом деятельности он занимается всю свою жизнь так как не имеет образования.Это единственный доход в семье поэтому он старается увеличить поголовье скота. Живут они в отдалённом кишлаке при горном расположении. Его скот пасётся в горах, а вечером сын Дехконбоя пригоняет домой. На полученный кредит хочет купить ещё десяток баранов и увеличить свое стадо.Заранее благодарит за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Dehkonboy is a 41 year-old man and a married father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker, taking care of the house and children, but helping her husband during her free time whenever possible.  Dehkonboy is fully involved in buying and selling small livestock.  He has been involved in this type of business his entire life and does not have any education.  This is the sole source of income in the family, and this is why he tries to increase the livestock headcount.  They live in a remote village in a mountainous location.  Dehkonboy's livestock goes to a pasture in the mountains, and his son brings the livestock home in the evenings.  Dehkonboy wants to buy another ten sheep and expand his herd.  He is grateful in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dossi Ayédé

texts.fr: Dossi Ayédé vit chez son mari avec trois enfants à charge qui sont tous scolarisés. Spécialisée dans la vente du maïs et des poissons fumés depuis 06 ans, elle se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée des habitants du quartier. Dans le souci de diversifier son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue d'accroître son bénéfice. Dossi Ayédé, avec ses bénéfices, veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et aider son mari à construire une latrine dans leur maison.
texts.en:
Dossi Ayédé lives with her husband and her three dependent children who all go to school. A specialist in the sale of maize and smoked fish for the past six years, she buys her stock at a market in Benin and sells to the locals. 

Eager to diversify her activity and to meet the needs of a growing customer base, she turned to Finadev for financial support to help bolster her profits, which she will use to contribute to her children’s tuition and to help her husband to build a latrine in their home.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of maize and 10 baskets of fish.

loans.name: Carmen Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Carmen; la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,gaseosas,entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia a la vez continua con el negocio de de lubricentro ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para la tienda como gaseosas.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen is continuing to operate her grocery store.  She sells items such as rice, sugar, milk, sodas and other products.  She is a hardworking and responsible person who is highly motivated to continue working for her family.  At the same time she is continuing to run an oil change service to help her family get ahead.

She is seeking the loan in order to buy merchandise for her store, such as sodas. She is grateful for the loan opportunity and promises to repay her loan according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store, such as sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the following materials: cement blocks, sand, gravel, and cement.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Villa Unida” perteneciente a la comuna  de San Javier ubicada en la ciudad de Linares.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace 8 meses. Realizó algunos cursos de especialización, lo que le permitió perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio. Específicamente en corte de pelo, peinados y tinturas.
Maria se desempeña en sus labores de peluquería de lunes a domingo  desde las 09ºº hasta las 19.30ºº horas, cuando necesita hacer tramites contrata a una ayudante para que le vea su local que lo ubica en el centro.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora que se especializa en vender productos para el cabello.
Con el crédito comprará un mueble de peluquería, tinturas, shampo, cremas, lacas.
Una de las metas de Maria en su negocio, son tener la posibilidad de tener a alguien de confianza que trabaje con ella establemente, además agrandar su local para incluir otros implementos de peluquería, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su pareja, ya que sus hijos son grandes y ya formaron sus propias familias. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son trabajar en su peluquería que ubica en el centro durante las mañanas y en las tardes trabajar en su casa.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal. Ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
San Javier es una comuna y ciudad de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Maule. Se caracteriza por ser una zona esencialmente vitivinícola. Los viñedos locales pertenecen a la zona denominada Valle del Loncomilla, de donde provienen algunos de los mejores vinos chilenos, Viña Carolina y Viña Gillmore, entre otras.
texts.en:
María’s a member of the “Villa Unida” communal bank belonging to San Javier commune located in the city of Linares. Her line of work for the last 8 months has been a beauty salon.  She took some special courses that allowed her to perfect her skills and to start her business, specifically haircuts, hair styling and hair coloring.

María works in the beauty salon Monday through Sunday from 9am until 7:30pm.  When she needs to do any errands she hires an assistant to watch the shop which is located downtown.  She buys her merchandise from a supplier that specializes in hair products.  She will use the loan to buy a beauty salon station, hair color, shampoo, creams and hairspray.

One of María’s business goals is to hire a trustworthy person to work with in a stable way.  She also wants to enlarge her shop to include other beauty services in order to generate higher income leading to a better quality of life.

María lives with her spouse since her children are all grown now and have formed their own families.  Her dream at a work level is to work in her beauty salon located downtown mornings and to work evenings from home.

She’s very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it will allow her to invest in her business.   She comments that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development because she’s learned to organize and better distribute her income and investments.

San Javier is a commune and city in central Chile belonging to the Maule region.  It’s notable for being a wine producing zone.  The local vineyards belong to a zone called Valle del Loncomilla where some of Chile’s best wines come like Viña Carolina and Viña Gillmore, among others.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es: La socia Barbara continua con su negocio de la tienda de abarrotes, la socia se organiza muy bien y trabaja mucho. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. La socia Barbara por este medio económica saca adelante a su familia. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, tarros de leche y también gaseosas y refrescos.
texts.en: Member Barbara continues with her business, a grocery store. She is very well-organized and works hard. She has been in business for seven years already, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into it. This business is providing Barbara with the financial means to provide for her family. This time, she wants to invest her loan in the purchase of essential goods, such as sacks of rice, pasta, cans of milk, and also sodas and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, pasta, cans of milk, and also sodas and soft drinks.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo la familia lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Dolores del Pilar la cual tiene una pulpería desde hace 18 años en la que comercializa desde granos básicos, productos de aseo, productos de uso personal…etc. El crédito lo invertirá en queso, arroz, azúcar, aceite, tortilla, pan, baterías, sardinas.
Las otras integrantes son Lorenza quien vende papel de reciclaje, Rosa quien vende ropa usada y chivería y Jacoba quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The La Familia group has three hardworking and enterprising members, one of which is Dolores del Pilar. She has owned a small grocery store for 18 years. In this shop she sells goods from dry grains, to cleaning products, and personal  products, etc. She will invest the loan in cheese, rice, sugar, oil, tortillas, bread, batteries and sardines. 

The other members are Lorenza, who sells recycled paper, Rosa, who sells second hand clothes and snacks and Jacoba, who owns a small grocery store as well.

loans.use: to buy chees, rice, sugar, oil, tortillas, bread, batteries and sardines.

loans.name: Mi Pequeña Hacienda Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Haydee Hermelinda, tiene 47 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella es socia del grupo "Mi Pequeña hacienda", formado por 8 socios, quienes son vecinos del distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Haydee Hermelinda, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de verduras, ella inició como ambulante desde que su hijo tenía dos añitos, se encontraba sola por lo que tuvo que tomar la decisión de iniciar un negocio para poder cubrir los gastos de su pequeño hijo, hoy en día ella alquila un puesto en un mercado cerca a su casa, siendo uno de sus anhelos comprar y ser dueña de su propio puesto para dejar de pagar alquiler.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de verduras a precio por mayor.
En la parte superior se encuentra la señora Yanet.
texts.en:
Haydee Hermelinda is 47 years old and has a son. She is a member of the group "Mi Pequeña Hacienda". The group consists of eight members, who are neighbors in the district of Comas. 

Haydee Hermelinda has been selling vegetables for five years. She began as a street vendor when her son was two years old. She was alone and therefore she decided to start a business in order to cover the expenses of her young son. Now she rents a stall in a market near her home. One of her biggest desires is to buy and be the proprietor of her own stall to stop paying rent. 

She will invest the loan she received in buying vegetables at wholesale price. The person in the upper part of the photo is Sra. Yanet.

loans.use: to invest in buying wholesale vegetables

loans.name: Manuel Eliseo

texts.es:
Manuel empezó trabajando de albañil; con los trabajos de albañilería que realizó y sus deseos de superación decidió emprender un negocio que le reporte mejores ingresos; de esta manera, hace ya más de 01 año que Manuel se dedica al reparto de helados, su negocio consiste en comprar por mayor y luego distribuirlos en tiendas y mercados de su localidad, poco a poco ha llegado a hacerse conocido en este campo, ahora ya tiene clientes fijos.  
Él se siente orgulloso ya que con su trabajo ha podido mejorar su vivienda y mantenido su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de helados ya que tiene muchos pedidos por entregar. Más adelante desea comprar un carro donde pueda trasportar su mercadería. Manuel de 62 años es separado  y tiene 02 hijos independientes.  Agradece a los prestamistas Kiva que hicieron posible que siga con su negocio.
texts.en: Manuel began working as a bricklayer. With the income he generated there and with his desire to succeed, he decided to open his own business which will give him a better income. For more than a year now he has been a distributor of frozen desserts. His business consists of buying in bulk and then distributing them to area stores and markets. He has gradually become well known in the area, as he has his regular customers. He feels proud now that through his work he has been able to improve his home and maintain his business. This loan will be used to buy frozen desserts as he already has orders to fulfill. Later he wishes to purchase a car he can use to transport his merchandise. Manuel is 62 years old, he is separated, and he has two grown children. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy frozen desserts.

loans.name: Celia Iveth

texts.es:
Celia tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida que es pescador artesanal y su hijo en casa de su suegra a la orilla de una laguna. Celia se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco que extrae de la laguna su esposo y otros pescadores. Además, del pescado ella vende golosinas, papas fritas, panes y refrescos.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para construir una casa pequeña de ladrillo y lámina en la parte alta de la laguna, debido a que cuando llueve mucho el nivel del agua de la laguna inunda las casas de la parte baja, por lo que se hace necesario la evacuación de las personas y sus pertenencias. Con la inversión quieren evitar la presencia de enfermedades por el exceso de humedad o en el peor de los casos perder la vida en una situación de inundación por la noche y que estén dormidos. 

Celia desea construir su casa de forma más segura y permanente, hacer que su negocio crezca para tener las condiciones económicas para cubrir junto con su compañero de vida las necesidades básicas de su hogar y brindarle la oportunidad de estudiar a su hijo de dos años cuando tenga la edad.
texts.en:
Celia is 20 years old and lives with her life partner, who is a local fisherman, and her son in her mother-in-law house at the shore of a lagoon. Celia sells fresh fish that her husband and other fishermen fish at the lagoon. In addition to the fish, she sells candy, chips, breads and drinks.

She is applying for a loan to Fundación Campo to build a small house of bricks and sheets of metal in the top of the lagoon. When it rains a lot, the water level of the lagoon floods the houses at the bottom of it, and therefore it's necessary to evacuate people and their belongings. With the investment they want to avoid diseases due to the excess of humidity, or even worse, the loss of their lives in a flood situation at night when they are asleep. 

Celia wants to build a more secure and permanent house. She also wants to expand her business in order to have enough income, jointly with her life partner, to cover the basic needs of her home. They want to give the opportunity to study to his two year old once he has the age.

loans.use: to build a small house of bricks and sheets of metal in the top of the lagoon

loans.name: Ruth Emily

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Ruth, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven que se dedica a trabajar en la empresa privada, pero alterna sus actividades con la venta de ropa de forma directa al cliente, por ello invertirá su préstamo para comprar mercadería como chompas, pantalones, casacas y camisas para cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes, Ruth en este momento está embarazada de su primogénito y es su sueño ofrecerle todo lo ella pueda darle para que no le falte nada, ella quiere hacer crecer su comercio para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y recibir a su primer hijo con un negocio propio y prospero.
Ruth está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse con su actividad para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su futuro hijo.
texts.en:
Ruth belongs to the “Ahorro Es Progreso” [Saving is Progress] communal bank in the Saylla district in the city of Cusco, Peru.  This young woman works for a private company.  However, she alternates her activities with selling clothes directly to customers.

She will use her loan to buy merchandise like sweaters, pants, jackets, and shirts to fill her customers’ orders.  Ruth is now pregnant with her first child.  

She dreams of giving her child everything she can so that he or she does not lack for anything.  She wants to make her business grow in order to improve her income.  She also wants to receive her first child having her own, prosperous business.

Ruth is very happy and grateful to Kiva for allowing her to develop with her business activity in order to provide her future child with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, pants, jackets, and shirts.

loans.name: Cariñito Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CARIÑITO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victorina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, tejido de ajuar para bebe, venta de maní al horno y tostado, venta de hortalizas y papa, salón de belleza, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos YAMBAL y EZIKA, venta de bolsas, preparación de documentos contables, café internet, chofer asalariado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoriana es una integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por necesidad a un grupo de una de sus amigas en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de ajuares de bebe a máquina; cuenta que  este emprendimiento fue de su madre hace varios años, donde ella apoyaba a realizarlo, posteriormente su madre le heredó este emprendimiento.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de materia prima (compra de lana) mismo que comprarán de la frontera de Bolivia – Perú y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa a las galerías a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención y las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Sonia ni el señor Santos ambos por motivos personales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Cariñito” is starting its first loan cycle with the organization Pro Mujer.  They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Santiago. The group is comprised of 11 members and is led by a board of directors, whose president is Victoriana.

The members are engaged in a variety of businesses, including:

- Selling cosmetics, purses, vegetables

- Selling roasted and toasted peanuts

- Making baby clothes

- Preparation of accounting documents

- A beauty salon

- An internet cafe

- A chauffeur business

The loan will benefit these small business owners, one of whom is Victoriana.  She reports that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining a group that one of her friends was in.  Currently she has a business making baby clothes, using a knitting machine.  She says that she learned this business from her mother over the course of several years and supported her mother in her business.  Eventually her mother passed the business down to her.

The loan she is seeking is to buy wool.  She will buy this wool at the border of Bolivia and Peru.  After she makes the clothing she will sell it to retailers.  This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family; she is single and has a son.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the attention and the training in the areas of health and finance.

Note: for personal reasons, neither Sonia nor Santos appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy wool.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dossi Angèle

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé à 16 ans et le moins âgé à 05 ans, Dossi Angèle a une boutique où elle vend des tissus, des parfums, des gels, des savons et d'autres produits depuis 08 mois. Elle s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans les marchés les plus proches de son fonds de commerce. Dans le but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un micro crédit à Finadev. Le revenu supplémentaire dégagé par ce crédit lui permettra de participer à l'éducation de ses enfants et d'aider son mari à changer la toiture de leur maison.
texts.en:
A married mother of three children, in school, of whom the oldest is 16 and the youngest is 5, Dossi Angèle has had a shop where she sells cloth, perfumes, gels, soaps, and other products for eight months. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the markets closest to her livelihood. 

With the goal of bolstering her buying power and satisfying the demands of her customers, Dossi Angèle requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. The extra revenues earned from this loan will enable her to help with her children's education and assist her husband to replace the roof of their house.

loans.use: to buy 2 lengths of cloth, a box of perfume, a box of soap, a box of 'moustitos', and 12 containers of gel

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sadiath Alimatou's Group

texts.fr: Alimatou Sadiath est la responsable d'un groupe composé de deux membres en caution solidaire. Agée de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés dans une école de la place. Elle vend des glacières, des plastiques, des tissus, des chaussures et d'autres articles depuis sept ans. Elle se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de renforcer son activité et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un financement à Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra d'accroître son revenu additionnel et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle envisage aider sa mère à se faire opérée à l'œil. Alimatou Sadiath se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
Alimatou Sadiath is the official of a group composed of two members who guarantee each other in solidarity. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children, of whom two are in a local school. She has been selling coolers, plasticware, cloth, shoes, and other items for seven years. She stocks up from one of the markets in Benin. 

With the aim of bolstering her business and responding favorably to the demands of her customers, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to help with her children's education. She envisions helping her mother to get an eye operation. 

Alimatou Sadiath is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 3 insulated containers (coolers), 2 lengths of cloth, 3 pairs of shoes, 4 pallets of drinks of various types

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 24 years old and married to Delina. They are newly married and have no children yet. Joan provides transport services through his motorbike, a business he ventured into three years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

Joan wants to purchase another motorbike for transportation in order to boost his monthly income. He has requested a second loan of KES 60,000.

The profit he makes from his business will help him open up a grocery shop for his wife, who is currently a housewife. His dream is to invest in public transportation as well as bring up a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 50 kilos of fertilizers and pay for labor expenses.

loans.name: Lidaou Group

texts.fr: Épouse d’un maçon, mère de 07 enfants (06 scolarisés)Tchilalo est née en 1959. Elle est ménagère et en même temps agricultrice. Elle est la responsable d’un groupement  nommé « LIDAOU » composé d’agriculteurs (hommes et femmes). C’est en 1992, que madame Tchilalo a démarré son activité dans la RÉGION CENTRALE. Elle est à son second crédit de notre institution et ce montant l’aidera à s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles. Elle veut à l’avenir agrandir sa superficie cultivable et aider ses enfants au coté de son mari à mieux réussir leurs vies. Les autres membres aussi veulent acheter des intrants agricoles afin d’avoir un bon rendement et mieux s’occuper de leurs familles.
texts.en:
The wife of a mason, Ms. Tchilalo is the mother of seven children (six in school) and was born in 1950. She is a homemaker and also a farmer. She is the official of the group named "LIDAOU", composed of farmers (men and women). Ms. Tchilalo started her business in 1992 in RÉGION CENTRALE. 

She is on her second loan with our institution, and this money will help her to stock up on farm supplies. She wants to expand her arable land in the future and, along with her husband, help her children to be more successful in their lives. 

The other members of the group also want to buy farm supplies in order to have a good crop yield and take better care of their families.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celia has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to buy additional farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from fishing and from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 43 years old and married with four children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Jessica has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and selling native products.

Jessica aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Lovella

texts.en:
Ma. Lovella is 38 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Ma. Lovella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Lovella has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.. 

In the future Ma. Lovella would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 51 years old, married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Chita has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Chita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and equipment needed for fishing business.

Chita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Chita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and equipment needed for fishing

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 28 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emelyn has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support 10 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 3500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergencies.

Gloria is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Intwari Ii Group

texts.fr:
Jeremie  fait partie du groupe Intwari II et  habite à Bujumbura.  C’est un celibataire de 29ans.
Il prend soin d’un orphelin qui étudie.

 Il fait le commerce des habits depuis  6 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait   faire le mariage et voir son commerce prospérer.
texts.en:
Jeremie is part of the group Intwari II and lives in Bujumbura. He is unmarried and 29 years old. He takes care of an orphan, who is in school. 

Jeremie has been doing commerce in clothing for six years. 

This is his first loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large amount of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, he would like to get married and see his business prosper.

loans.use: to buy a lot of clothing to resell

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business by having a better selection of clothes available for her customers. On this occasion she’ll buy women’s and men’s trousers, blouses, skirts, socks, etc., in new styles and colors to offer quality products to her customers.

Mejumaa would like to diversify her businesses. The previous loan enabled her to to save money to open this new clothes selling business. However, she still operates her vegetable grocery. 

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s trousers, blouses, skirts, socks, etc.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 54 years old and married with 4 children.

Merlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Merlina has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Merlina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Mila has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from fish vending and pig fattening.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Mildred requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing boat.

Mildred has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing boat

loans.name: Abadahigwa / Gtmb Group

texts.fr:
David fait partie du groupe Abadahigwa / Mshsh. Le nom du groupe signifie «Membres des performances ». Il a 48 ans, il est marie, a 6 enfants de 8 ans à 20 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

David est agriculteur des tomates. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 60kgs des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des tomates, il planifie de demande d’autre prêt pour finance ses activités et travailler beaucoup pour obtenir de grande quantité des tomates. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait devenir le meilleur cultivateur des tomates. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
David is part of the group Abadahigwa / Mshsh. The group's name means "Members of Performances". He is 48 years old and married, and he has six children, aged 8 to 20 years old, all in school. He has a 6th grade education. 

David is a tomato farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 60 kg of fertilizers and to pay for labor. 

To expand his tomato farm, he plans on requesting another loan to finance his business and working a lot to obtain a large quantity of tomatoes. 

In the next few years, he would like to become the best tomato farmer. With the profits, he plans on covering the cost of schooling his children.

loans.use: to buy 60 kg of fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Jijigee

texts.en:
Mr. Jijigee, age 57, is a librarian for a college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing his job for many years. He lives with his wife. All of their children moved out of their parents' house. 

Mr. Jijigee's house has some problems such as heat loss and damages to the roof and inside the walls. He is planning to make repairs and insulate the walls with rock, wool, cement and foam. He believes his home will be warmer after the insulation and after he adds a new furnace. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long, cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40 Fahrenheit, even in the cities.  

Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. Additionally, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of the main reasons for Mongolian air pollution. 

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers green loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy natural gas for cars. The loan Mr. Jijigee is taking will be used to buy building materials for home repair.

loans.use: To buy building materials for home repair.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph  is  a 34-year-old businesswoman  who lives in Juba.  She is married and has four  children between the ages of 4 and 10. All go to school. 

Joseph   runs  a hotel and has been in business for two years. She   has  two  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients   and  she  is taking a loan of 1200  SDG to purchase    sugar, 'sisa'  and many other items. In addition to this she has no other source of income.

In 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Her   major challenges include high prices in the market. 

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like 'sisa', tea, milk, meat, etc

loans.name: Pausia

texts.en:
Pausia is 30 years old and married with 7 children.

Pausia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Pausia has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 4 years and also earns an income from selling fish.

Pausia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives in Kechut village with his parents. For many years Andranik's parents have been involved in cattle breeding. Now Andranik is also involved in agriculture and plans to expand the family farm. 

With the help of this loan he will purchase a cow and two calves. These changes will significantly support Andranik in making the farm more profitable and investing in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and two calves

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region
